boardgame.name: The Middle Ages
boardgame.description:
The Middle Ages is a card game for 3-4 players set in Europe during the Middle Ages, with each player taking on the role of a rival ruler, focused on expanding their holdings and weathering the perils of unrest and plague.

The Middle Ages uses a mix of hand management, worker placement, and multi-use cards. The game is driven by the Player Turn cards, which, in combination with the player's unique Accord card, dictate what the player can and must do during their turn.

Each turn, the player must add one card from their hand to a player's Coterie (theirs or another player's - there are benefits and drawbacks to either). After adding a card to a Coterie, if the player has 3 or more cards in their Coterie, they return all cards in their Coterie and receive a number actions based the cards that were returned. For each Action, a player can play a card to their Structures.

When the deck runs out for the second time, the game ends and players score points for their Accord Icons, Wealth, and Structures. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: UK Adventure 01: House Party
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Suggested Power Level: 6-8

Suggested Number of Players: 4-6.

Your new team of heroes is looking to make a name for themselves, and they have just found out about a rather upmarket gang headquarters in a quiet part of southern England. The thing is, the gang running it have their own ideas about security.

This adventure is designed so it can be replayed three times and is published under the Superpowered by M&M Licence.

boardgame.name: UK Adventure 02: The Battle of Rochester
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Suggested Power Level: 6-8

Suggested Number of Players: 4-6.

Your team of heroes hears about a mercenary about to raise hell during a local festival at Rochester in south-east England. They know he's going to visit a bookshop, but they don't expect how he plans to defend himself. And they need to stop him before he endangers the whole country.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 21
boardgame.description: The march of technology across BattleTech's eras is relentless, but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic 'Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond). Allowing beloved units redesigned for the BattleTech: Clan Invasion crowd funding campaign to be competitive on "modern" battlefields, this series also includes in-universe development notes, battle histories, notable pilots, and record sheets for each 'Mech.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Wiz'N'Bang
boardgame.description:
Wiz’N’Bang is a tower-building and defence card game for 2-4 players that takes 15-30 minutes to play.

Players take on the role of a wizard attempting to construct the perfect tower on the perfect hill, the problem being every other wizard trying to do the same.

During turns players use Action Points to perform a selection of different Actions. These include: Moving your wizard up or down your tower. Making use of tower cards such as Cannons, Dragons, Portals, and more, to construct your tower one floor at a time in the most offensive or defensive way you please. Using a wide selection of spells such as Fireball, Counter, Deadeye, and more, to defend your precious tower against the nefarious machinations of your enemies.

The winner is the player who can successfully build a tower seven cards high and get their wizard to the top.

Simple in concept but with amazing depth, Wiz’N’Bang brings together card drafting, tower building, dice rolling, meeple management, and spell casting into a delightfully small package that won’t break the bank or hog the table.

boardgame.name: Alpha Supplement
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ALPHA SUPPLEMENT is our first FREE mini expansion, providing a raft of new options for every lifer, crump and neller in the vert:

Expanded Starting Augments tables for each class
Expanded Starting Contacts tables for each class
Nine new Firearms
Fourteen new Cyberware pieces AND

boardgame.name: Barrow of the Broken
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aye, that’s the report from Ol’ Walloc. Some kind of giant reptile, preying on the farm stock, tearing down fencing, you know how it goes. Along the border lands, o’ course; beast’s no threat to the folk sheltering behind Northgate’s walls. Still, we can’t abandon thems brave enough to face the thuels and Wodon knows what else to feed the city. They tracked the beast to an old ruin about ten miles distant, but didn’t fancy their chances. So the rangers returned, made their report, put the word out. And ‘ere you are.

In BotB, the PCs set off in search of a giant reptile only to discover - well yes a Mutant Reptile Beast - but so much more! Ghosts, giant toads, deadly fungus, a golem, and if they take the time to listen... a tragic tale.

boardgame.name: Seven Doors of Memnos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare for some frostbitten tomb raiding, in search of seven witch idols from the Second Age... Total 26 pages, including seven mini tomb maps and Pregens.

boardgame.name: Stick Collection
スティックコレクション
boardgame.description:
Let's win a stick with a 5 mm difference! Join the auction as a stick collector! Bid for a worthwhile stick with only a 5mm difference.

Players compete for sticks that are put on the table one by one. The more sticks you collect with a 5mm difference in length, the more you score, but don't get their size to close to them during a competition because you can't measure them except by your eye. While consulting with your money, consider carefully and decide whether to participate in the competition or pass. If someone runs out of money or someone competes for 8, it adds points to the score at the end of the game, but if a player can align 4 of the same length in the middle of the game, they can win immediately. It is a unique competition game where overconfidence and disappointment in eye measurement are fun.

スティックコレクターとしてオークションに参加しよう!
価値ある5mm違いのスティックを見た目で落札するのです。

プレイヤーは、一本ずつテーブルに出されるスティックを競り落としていきます。
長さが5mm違いのスティックを集めるほど得点になっていきますが、競りの最中はスティックに近づいてはいけません。所持金と相談しながら、じっくり見つめて競りに参加するかパスするか決断してください。
参加者の視線を浴びながら、競り落としたスティックを手中に収めるたび、答え合わせで盛り上がります。
誰かの所持金がなくなるか、誰かが8本競り落としたらゲーム終了で得点計算ですが、もしゲーム途中で同じ長さを４本揃えることができたら即勝利というオプションがあります。
目測への過信と失望が楽しい異色の競りゲームです。

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Viking See-Saw
バイキングシーソー
boardgame.description:
Let's load our luggage, but don't let the ship tip!

Players alternately place their luggage on the 3D ship model. The deck is always on a slope where the load is put, so place carefully. If the ship tilts, you have to pick up the ship's chest as your own baggage as a penalty. The ship tilts easily, so it's a race for luggage to be laid before the ship tips to the other side. If someone finishes placing all their baggage or the penalty chests runs out, the game ends.

Since each of the different luggage is a different material like brass, aluminum, iron, glass, acrylic, and wood, the strategy and fun of the game is guessing the weight right as to not tip the ship.


船が傾かないように荷物を置いていこう!

プレイヤーは、自分の荷物を交互に船にのせていきます。荷物をのせるのは常に傾きが上のデッキです。もし船が傾いてしまったら、ペナルティとして船のチェストを自分の荷物として引き取らなければなりません。船は必ず傾くので荷物の置き合いのチキンレースが繰り返されます。誰かが全ての荷物をのせ終わるか、ペナルティのチェストがなくなったらゲーム終了となります。

荷物コマは、真鍮、アルミ、鉄、ガラス、アクリル、木、と異なる素材であるため、重さの推測の楽しさと、攻めと守りの戦略が生まれ、一味も二味も違ったシーソーゲームに仕上がっています。

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Friends Trivia Game
boardgame.description: A trivia game based on the TV series "Friends". The goal of the game is to be the first player or team to get 10 answers correct. Very simple concept with no board or pieces outside of 54 cards.

boardgame.name: Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites
boardgame.description:
Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites is an apocalyptic survival board game, with an engaging balance between luck and strategy. All players start off as Human and explore the board to be the first to survive 12 months of the Apocalypse. However, the Zombie City and Vampire Graveyard is out there and players who discover these locations become those fearsome horrors. And if that’s not enough to make you fret, then have fun dodging the pesky meteorites that continually change the course of the game!

At the start of a player’s turn, they roll the 6-sided Movement Dice and move that many spaces. If they land on an unexplored space, they pull at random a location and build the map. Locations can consist of Elements, Villages, Mountains, Zombie City, or Vampire Graveyard. Then, for a Human player, they decide how to use any collected Elements to work toward Survival Points or decide to attack another player before ending their turn. On a Zombie’s turn, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 less than the number rolled, but can control up to 6 Zombies in a single turn. Their turn ends when all movements and attacks are used. For the Vampire, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 more than the number rolled, and decide whether to Suck Blood for Energy or Attack a player using Energy to obtain a Coffin. Their turn ends when all movements or attacks are used.

In the scenario a player rolls a SURVIVE! on the Movement Dice, they immediately roll the two Coordinate dice to determine where a Meteorite or Supply Crate lands on the board before concluding that player’s turn automatically.

The Game ends when a Player achieves the requirements to survive the apocalypse. For the Human, it’s collecting 12 months of Supplies (a combination of Elements, Supply Crates, and Defenses). For the Zombie, it’s Replicating in each Human Village and returning all 6 Zombies to the City. And the Vampire must obtain Blood Drops and all 5 Human Coffins before concluding their turn in the Graveyard.

boardgame.name: FrogKnight: Ribbit Royale
boardgame.description:
A battle has broken out between Frogs, Knights, and all creatures of the Ribbit Kingdom.

Players battle around the board acquiring all different kinds of weapons, ranging from a measly fly-swatter to Bazooka to a swarm of flesh-eating beetles and eliminating other players. As the playable area shrinks, players are forced in towards the middle until one is left standing as King of the Hill. Champion Royale. Winner, Winner, its Flies for Dinner!

boardgame.name: Empire Planners
boardgame.description:
This game combines components (25 cards, 27 dice, 27 cubes) from the first 3 Nano9Games - Empire, Railways and City Planner - and has both a solo and two player mode.

Players compete to build and upgrade buildings, create railways, move passengers to their destinations and produce goods in their factories in order to gain Capital and create Profit.

Empire Planners is strictly a rulebook. Players will need Empire, Railways and City Planner to play.

boardgame.name: Bonfire Party
みんなのファイヤー
boardgame.description:
Everybody's Fire so light it with your heart! A collaborative game perfect for an ice breaker. "One, Two, fire!"

It is a cooperative game to bring up the flame by playing a match in. Working together to lay patterns of matches, working to increase the flames. Aim to ignite the flame of the smallest "1" at first, with a total of five flamings. The match in the hand is put out at the same time by the shout of "One, Two! Fire!"

If the total number of colors in either match, red or blue, becomes "1", the ignition succeeds. Next, we aim to grow flames with "2", "3", "4", and "5". Even if it succeeds or fails, the match that you put out will be put on the pedestal, It might be a hint, saying that "That person's color will come out next time". If someone's match runs out on the way, the game is over. If you can't increase the flames splendidly, try extinguishing the fire.


ハートで火をつけろ！
アイスブレークにぴったりな協力ゲーム。

「せーの、ファイヤー!」でマッチを出しあって、炎を育てる協力ゲームです。
お互いを気にかけ、心を一つにして炎を大きくしていきます。

炎コマは全部で５つ、最初は一番小さな「１」の炎の着火を目指します。
手に持ったマッチを「せーの！ファイヤー」の掛け声で全員同時に出しあって、
赤と青、どちらかのマッチの色の数の合計が「１」になれば着火成功。
次に「２」「３」「４」「５」と炎を育てることを目指します。
成功しても失敗しても、出したマッチは台座にくべていくので、
「あの人、次はこの色出すかな〜」とヒントになるかも知れません。
途中で誰かのマッチがなくなったらゲーム終了です。
見事炎を大きくできたら、消火にもチャレンジしてみてください。

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Some Bunny's Hiding
boardgame.description:
The Bunnies have hidden in their holes around the game board.

Each player receives three discs and tries to match the colors on their discs to the colors hidden on the bottom of the bunny playing pieces. The first player to find all their bunnies wins! Double-sided game board features two difficulty levels that progress as your child masters memorization and color recognition skills.

boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game
boardgame.description:
In Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game, the hunger takes hold after many superheroes in the Marvel Universe have been turned into zombies. You play as these infected heroes and will be eating people to satisfy your hunger...and objectives within the game.

Marvel Zombicide is a stand-alone game using mostly the same Zombicide mechanics but set in the Marvel Universe.

boardgame.name: Broken Planet
boardgame.description:
The Broken Planet is on the verge of destruction and the only force holding the planet together is the will of the Gods. The planet cannot give enough resources to sustain all living tribes. So the tribes will enter a trial to decide who will become the favored tribe. So, the goal of the game is to gain as much Godly favor as possible.

Players are scavenging tribes that collect powerful gemstones during their turn on the floating islands of the Broken Planet. A player's standard turn consists of movement and gemstone collection. Movement is performed by secretly choosing an island number on the game board with your compass and then keeping it hidden until all other tribes have chosen a location. Afterwards, everybody reveals their location and performs the movement at the same time. Tribes will find different temples on the islands, each displaying the gemstone type that can be collected there. After adding the collected gems to their hand, a new turn starts and players repeat these steps.

Each round, one tribe will enter the 'Offer Phase' and may discard gemstones cards for special actions. These actions include building temples for unique effects, creating relics to gain Godly favor, or attacking other players with a divine strike. Each of these actions can gain favor in their own respective way. The offering player cannot move nor collect, but all other tribes can! The offering role is passed down clockwise each turn. The amount of discarded gemstones depends on the costs of the Offer Phase actions.

All players play simultaneously! So it's key to see what gemstones other players need for their actions, and what gems they already have in order to predict their next moves.

The game ends after X turns depending on the amount of players. When the last round has been played, each player counts their favor. The player with the most favor wins the game.

boardgame.name: Fastrek
boardgame.description:
Fastrek is a cooperative game for kids 5 years and above that required teamwork and strategy to win. Play tested and reviewed by teachers, enjoyed by kids and loved by parents. This game can be played by 2 - 4 players.

In Fastrek, players roll their dice to move around the board. Depending on the spot they land on, players may collect items, encounter monsters, pick an event card or move to another spot on the board.

To win, all players must get to camp before nightfall AND have all the necessary camping items to set up camp.

boardgame.name: ハナニソム (Hananisomu)
boardgame.description:
ハナニソム (Hananisomu) is a 2 player game from Japan where players compete to enjoy the cherry blossom viewing. In Japan, since the 8th century, it is custom to pass a pleasant afternoon in the spring, sitting under the cherry and plum trees, enjoying the blossoms while eating and drinking with your friends. This is known as Hanami, and is seen all across Japan as the blossoms open.

In this game, the two players are trying to create the best flower viewing experience for their friends. By laying out ground sheets under the trees, and providing food and drink, players score points. The most points wins the game.

Players take turns laying tiles in three colours, and putting markers for people on them. By controlling the largest areas connected to trees, and having the right type of people connected to the foods they like, a player can maximise their score.
user summary

This is a two-player game where players line up leisure sheets in a park full of cherry blossoms and the winner is the one who gets the best basho (spot under the trees) for the visitors. The player who gets the best basho for the visitors wins the game.

桜の咲く公園にレジャーシートを並べていき、訪れるお花見客により良いバショを取ってあげたプレイヤーが勝利する、2人用の陣取りゲームです。
自分のバショ = 陣地を、他のバショより大きくしたり、桜に隣接させたり、お花見客の好物を集めたりすることで得点が上がり、勝利に近づきます。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: ヴォーグ (VOGU)
boardgame.description:
ヴォーグ (VOGU) is a tile placement game from Japan about sneaker dealers (the game box is styled to look like a shoebox).

The game has a deck of cards showing sneakers in two colours (red/yellow, green, blue for example). Players are dealt a hand of cards, and on their turn either play a card to the table, or place a card in front of themselves and gain a matching colour token to multiply their end score.

Cards that are placed must match their neighbouring cards. As each card is placed, the popularity of the colours alters on a chart.

When the game ends, players have 4 cards left in total, in hand and in front of them. They multiply out the colours they hold plus tokens, against the colours' scores on the chart.

By placing a card in front, a player gains a multiplier, but shows the other players which colours they favour. Players must balance trying to improve colours place on the chance, against holding good scoring cards at the end.

The publisher includes a webtool to help calculate the end scores.
user summary

In the ever-changing fashion world, you are a sneaker dealer.
Place cards with colorful sneakers every turn and control the color trends by combining adjacent cards.
Read the ever-changing value of colors and the speculations of other players, and get around to get the highest value for your sneakers.

絶えず流行が移り変わるファッション界において、あなたはスニーカーを専門とするディーラーです。
毎ターン、カラフルなスニーカーが描かれたカードを配置して、隣り合ったカードの組み合わせで、色の流行を操作します。
刻々と変動する色の価値と他プレイヤーの思惑を読み、自分の持つスニーカーの価値が最も高くなるよう、上手く立ち回りましょう。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Minabo
boardgame.description:
Minabo is a social simulation game in which you will walk the life line while your turnip grows and thrives (or not) in its social relationships.

Source: Steam Page https://store.steampowered.com/app/1822560/Minabo__A_walk_th...

boardgame.name: ワンダーワードワールド (Wonder Word World)
boardgame.description:
ワンダーワードワールド (Wonder Word World) is a party game from Japan. Players are ambassadors from foreign nations. They take turns to memorise certain words, and then read a fairy tale out loud, but inserting their nation's words for key words in the story. The player giving the best and most dramatic reading is voted the winner.

The game includes booklets for five classic fairy tales, all in Japanese.
user summary

It is a memorization-type reading party game where you become ambassadors of countries with different languages ​​and take turns reading aloud while adding your own translations to the words that appear in fairy tales.

The player who remembers the strange words that increase as the story progresses and reads them aloud more steadily and dramatically than others wins.

変わった言語を持つ国々の大使となり、 おとぎ話に登場する単語に独自の訳をつけながら、 交代で朗読していく暗記系朗読パーティゲームです。
物語が進むにつれてどんどん増える、奇妙な単語を記憶して、 他の人よりよどみなく、そしてドラマチックに読み上げたプレイヤーが勝利します。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Atomik Conversion Kit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Atomik Add-Ons are generic sourcebooks that can be used with any game system. All the necessary conversions are already worked out in this document to use them with the following games and systems, so you just have to follow the guidelines.

Precis Intermedia Titles

genreDiversion 3E (BloodShadows 3E, Stormrift)
genreDiversion I (HardNova 2, Coyote Trail, Ghostories, EarthAD.2, Mean Streets)
The Character Archaic System
MasterBook and Shatterzone
Supergame 3E
Two-Fisted Tales 2E
Exiled in Eris
Worlds Beyond
Swords & Six-Siders, Lasers & Six-Siders
Iron Gauntlets (Impresa)

boardgame.name: Demons of the Abyss: Rank and File
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lower Planes are home to many foul and dangerous denizens. The demon race is particularly dangerous, given their propensity for destruction and the pleasure they gain from corrupting that which is good and lawful.

Formed from the souls of those evil, chaotic souls that succumbed to the worst excesses of sin, these spirits find a new outlet for their destructive desires as embodiments of pure chaos and evil.

Discover the demons that make up the rank and file of the Abyssal hordes, from the lowly stinky sloth demons to the fierce swamp demons.

Uncover new templates to create spheres-equivalent demons (and inspire to create other outsiders). Open the gates to Infinity and unleash the demons of Sphere’s Bestiary: Demons of the Abyss: Rank and File in the campaign.

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power/Spheres of Might systems

boardgame.name: The Witch of Faces
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Loss of Face

Ershabet was born a seeress, prone to strange and portentous visions. But it was not the future that she saw — or at least, not often enough for her powers to be of help to her family. What they at first had thought was a blessing turned out to be an empty promise. But her dreams were not empty, for in them she saw the Mother of a Hundred faces. She offered herself in devotion at once, and received her just rewards. The faces she borrowed from her fellow cultists — weird creatures scattered across many worlds — brought her the prosperity she desired, even if it was not always an honest living.

But as the years passed, she grew disillusioned with this cult she had joined. It was not enough for her to trade faces with someone far away. She did not want to give them back. She wanted to own them. So too, did she grow to hate her co-religionists, especially the monstrous ones. In time, even the mere thought of some inhuman creature using her face was enough to make her sick. And so she bade the Mother goodbye and forged a new path for herself — a path of murder.

Some would say that Ershabet became more monstrous than the ones that she despised. But then again, most of those who learn her true intentions do not live to tell the tale. For though she wears a mask of mummified faces, skull bones and all, she is not quick to tell how they are procured. That would scare off those she wishes to procure new faces from: her fellow adventurers.

boardgame.name: Torch & Blade
boardgame.description:
Torch & Blade is a pen and paper, solitaire, dungeon delving game set in a sword and sorcery world. You control intrepid adventurers braving dark and perilous dungeons in an attempt to bring back precious loot and complete arduous quests. The game can be played as a chronicle, an endless chronicle, or a short play campaign. No matter what game mode you choose, you will play several individual sessions, called acts.

During each act you will guide an adventurer through a randomly generated dungeon. The playing time for a single act, once you are familiar with the rules, should be between 60 and 120 minutes.

During a chronicle you will control several characters, alternating among them. At any point you will only have 2 to 4 active characters to pick from, and they will all either succumb or successfully retire and get replaced by new adventurers. A full chronicle can last anywhere between 24 and 192 acts, mostly falling around the middle of those extremes.

A short play campaign lets you complete a full campaign in a shorter time frame. You will control a single character until they either succumb or successfully retire. In this game mode there are no overarching legacy elements, apart from the progress made by your character. A short campaign lasts between 1 and 8 acts.

An endless chronicle lets you keep the legacy element of the standard chronicle, but it doesn't have a fixed end. You can keep creating new characters without end and keep playing until you get bored!

Designed for the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

boardgame.name: Cultistorm: Face 2 Face
boardgame.description:
In Cultistorm Face 2 Face one player takes on the role of the investigator, whereas the other player assumes the role of the cult leader.

The goal of the cult leader is to summon a Great Old One by holding dark rituals using a secret combination of elder signs to call forth and protect 4 cultists, whose job it is to complete the ritual.

The goal of the investigator is to prevent this by defeating the cultists that join the dark ritual each round. The investigator must keep on defeating them until there are not enough (fewer then 4) cultists left to complete the ritual. The investigator must deduce the elder signs connected to each cultist in order to defeat them.

A game consists of several rounds in which the cult leader and the investigator take alternating turns playing their cards.

If there are 4 cultists in play simultaneously, a Great Old One is placed at the end of the row. If the investigator cannot deduce all the remaining face-down ritual cards in his next turn right away (without revealing a card) the dark ritual is complete and the cult leader wins the game.

If the investigator manages to defeat 5 cultists by deducing all the ritual cards allocated to them, the cultists will not have enough power to summon their master and the investigator wins.

Face-2-Face was specifically designed with Essen Spiel ‘19 in mind.

boardgame.name: Because Potatoes
boardgame.description:
Meet Pata TENSLIP, King POTATO, Pata TAPOIL and Rocky POTATO in crazy adventures! Four types of potatoes have crazy accessories : crowns, boxing gloves, slip ... or nothing ;).

Each player has three cards in hand and one card is placed on the table to start the game. One by one, place a card that has a common point with the last card placed on the table. Win the fold by placing a card on the potato which has something in common with the previous one but nothing in common with the starting potato.
The game ends when the deck is empty. The player with the most of potatoes wins the game !

There is also 5 variants to increase fun and challenge!

boardgame.name: Micomicons en el bosque
boardgame.description:
What a mess! They have searched all the backpacks and the bag of goodies that you took to eat tonight at the bonfire have disappeared! In its place you have found a strange map with the signature of the "King Micomicon".

If you want to recover your sweets and perhaps find legendary characters and ancient treasures, you will have to enter the magical Forest of the Micomicons. Let the adventure begin!

Our objective will be to cross the magical forest of the Micomicons while we advance through the letters on the way until we reach the King with the objects that he asks us for matching our letters.

Players roll dice to move and pick up cards to deliver to the King. If they can't deliver to the king, they must move back 1plaec for each card in their hand.

In competitive mode, the first player who manages to reach the king and deliver the objects to him or, failing that, achieve what his roll of the dice indicates, will have won.

If we have played in cooperative mode, when one of the players reaches the king's card and they give him among all the objects he requests or get the action roll with the dice, they will have won.


¡Qué desastre! Han registrado todas las mochilas y la bolsa de chucherías que llevabais para comer esta noche en la hoguera han desaparecido! En su lugar habéis encontrado un extraño mapa con la firma del “Rey Micomicon”. Si queréis recuperar vuestras chuches y tal vez encontrar personajes de leyenda y antiguos tesoros , tendréis que adentraros en el Bosque mágico de los Micomicons. ¡Que comience la aventura! Así se nos presenta este juego que nos trae la editorial Enpeudejocedicions y que ha sido diseñado e ilustrado por Víctor Arenas.Nuestro objetivo será cruzar el bosque mágico de los Micomicons mientras avanzamos por las cartas de camino hasta llegar al Rey con los objetos que nos pide, en nuestras cartas.

El jugador robará una carta del mazo de cartas de objeto y podrá usar una de sus cartas de objeto de la mano dejándola sobre la mesa. Tras ver el resultado, llevará a cabo el efecto final de esa carta, que puede ser avanzar, retroceder o lo que se indique para finalizar su turno y dar paso al siguiente jugador.

En el modo competitivo, el primer jugador que consiga llegar hasta el rey y entregarle los objetos o en su defecto conseguir lo que su tirada de dados indica, habrá ganado.

Si hemos jugado en el modo cooperativo, cuando uno de los jugadores llegue a la carta del rey y le entreguen entre todos los objetos que solicita o consigan la tirada de acción con los dados, habrán ganado.

boardgame.name: Giftabell
boardgame.description:
A judge draws cards to help inspire a fictional character. One card gives the first letter of the character's name, the other card gives the first letter of a profession, species, or other descriptor.

Then, 2 more cards are drawn. Everyone else thinks of a 2-word ‘gift’, starting with one letter from each card. Whilst people are thinking of gifts, the judge can improvise some details about the person.

Once more than half the people have decided, they all explain their gifts and then the judge picks a winner (the most useful gift for that character), to become the new judge. That player also gets the 4 cards used in the round.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most cards is the winner!

boardgame.name: Be a Sailor Scout for D&D 5E
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

If you’ve ever wanted to fight evil by moonlight or win love by daylight, have we got the character sheets for you! Now you can play DnD 5e as your favorite Sailor Scout of the Inner Circle and take down the Negaverse. By the power of the moon, may your hits be crits!

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Rules Adjudication Guidance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dungeons and Dragons is by its nature a game with limited rules and infinite variation. There will inevitably come a time at most game tables a point where the rules end and we rely upon the Dungeon Master to adjudicate a situation fairly.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Expanded Campaign Options
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents extended race, sub-class, college / domain / circle / arcane traditions / oaths, feats, backgrounds, and weapons. It also presents extended lists of Greyhawk Deities.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Background
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It is no longer safe to be out at night. It is not safe to travel from town to town, except in groups. The dark somehow seems darker, more sinister. Only very powerful travel alone, or after dark. Or the very foolish.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

We welcome you to our Greyhawk Reborn (GHR) organized play campaign. Our primary goal is entertainment for everyone involved, players and DMs alike, while advocating for the gaming community.

Greyhawk Reborn is a new type of living campaign, one in which adventures are created and judged by each individual DM. At the same time, the campaign staff manages the campaign guidelines and documents and oversees the campaign story lines. We are using the Dungeons and Dragons 5E as a basis for our Greyhawk Reborn campaign. However, where there a differences between the D&D 5E rules and GHR campaign, the rules in this document have precedence.

One of the main goals of the Greyhawk Reborn campaign is to bring gamers together. As such, it will primarily be offered at conventions and game days. We believe that the more often gamers get together, and the greater numbers of gamers that get together, the greater the benefits to the gaming community overall.

Please keep in mind that the Greyhawk Reborn campaign will constantly strive to provide the best play experiences possible for our players. We will tweak, change and maybe even overhaul things to improve our campaign.

Understand that the rules in this document, and other Greyhawk Reborn documents to follow, may always be changed or tweaked, whether to adjust to rules updates, allow for better game balance, or simply to create more player enjoyment.

boardgame.name: Greyhawk Reborn Gen Con 2015 Adventures Story-Arc
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents a list of all the scenarios available for play, ca. 2015.

boardgame.name: Steampunk Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a campaign centered in the Victorian/Elizabethan Era. It’s a steampunk campaign that allows firearms with multiple new classes, equipment, vehicles, some races, among other things. In the campaign it is imagined that 4 - 8 players will be doing this campaign at one time.

boardgame.name: Zagor: La fortezza di Smirnoff
boardgame.description:
Zagor is a very popular Italian comic book, started in 1961 and still running. It is also popular in the balkans and in Turkey. The hero lives in the 19th century in North America, and helps anyone in need, often native americans.

In this text adventure (with some limited graphics) he must chase Count Smirnoff who stole the formula of a powerful explosive, and is hiding in Canada.

User summary

boardgame.name: Rainbow Rabbits: Friends Expansion – Frog & Lamb
boardgame.description: The Frog and the Lamb join the rabbits in the base game. Increases the player count by two.

boardgame.name: Five Parsecs From Home (Third Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Five Parsecs From Home is a solo adventure wargame where you assemble a ragtag crew of galactic trailblazers and head out to explore the stars, pick up jobs, and every now and then - engage in some action-packed, sci-fi combat!

boardgame.name: Ashes of Athas Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ashes of Athas is a single Dark Sun tale told in a series of chapters premiering at the gaming conventions Winter Fantasy, Gen Con, and Origins. At each convention, you can take your character through Ashes of Athas adventures that continue the story. The Premiere Campaign Venues table shows which chapters are available for play at each site. Each chapter is a series of three adventures that continue the same storyline.

boardgame.name: Ashes of Athas Pre-Generated Characters
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Ashes of Athas campaign offered pre-generated characters at several levels, including:


3rd Level: Erdan, Hakka, Meryt-Neitt, Nalag, Nebin, Tertio-Tet
4th Level: Mikka, Nedda, Pikikcha, Rhasgar, Stasi
5th Level: Dara, Elina, Tertio-Tet, Varis, Zedath
6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th Level: Andra-Andolin, Kal Sha Cha, Mara-Marok, Maveith-Mavra, Ruia-Raia, Thara-Theren


Character builds were presented in ".dnd4e" format (for automated build/print software) and PDF format (for print-and-play use).

boardgame.name: The Drunken Idiots Present: A Night Out
boardgame.description:
This three part board-style drinking game will take you through the pregame, adventures at the bar, and the drive home. Each section contains their own deck of cards based on real experiences. With up to 6 players A Night Out allows a realistic night out experience with your friends.

During their turn, a player will roll the die, move their game piece, and do what the space says but be careful! If you land on a check point, you could be sent to the drunk tank! The first player to make it to the home space wins!

Although designed with alcohol in mind, this game is compatible with non-alcoholic beverages so anyone can play!

boardgame.name: Spielend durch das schöne Heimatland!
boardgame.description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space A (Arnsberg). The first to reach space E (Volkmarsen) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Escape the Dark Castle: Tales from the Dark
boardgame.description:
This book can be used in the game to get to know the backstories of the various characters you can play as well as the bosses you may face at the end.

Immerse yourself into the world of Escape the Dark Caste with this collection of short fiction. Explore its landscapes, meet its inhabitants, and learn to truly fear its horrors over the course of 27 dark, interconnected stories.

Includes:

- 12 Character Tales – each an insight into the lives and personalities of the prisoners, and of course the dark events which led to their wrongful incarceration in the depths of the Dark Castle.

- 14 Boss Legends – offering up what little is known about the vile overlords of the Dark Castle, and how they are each believed to have wrought their despicable paths to power.

- A Recollection of the Unmapped Passages & Chambers of the Dark Castle – an ancient manuscript penned by a former prisoner of the castle, imparting the secret of a successful escape.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Escape the Dark Castle: Adventure Pack 1 – Cult of the Death Knight
Escape the Dark Castle: Adventure Pack 2 – Scourge of the Undead Queen
Escape the Dark Castle: Adventure Pack 3 – Blight of the Plague Lord
Escape the Dark Castle: Kickstarter Upgrade Kit
Escape the Dark Castle: The Collector's Box

boardgame.name: Rechtschreiben
boardgame.description: In the game there are 144 picture cards , each of which contains a drawn picture on the front and the written term and derivatives of it on the back. In turn, each player takes a picture card and reads the term to the next player. The next player must write it down. If he has written it down correctly, he receives the picture card. The first player to collect 7 picture cards wins the game. Additional spelling exercises are also included.

boardgame.name: Bilderquiz
boardgame.description:
On 3 large picture boards, objects are depicted that have certain properties (color, shape, number). A rotary wheel is used to randomly select which property (e.g. "yellow") is being searched for. The first person to point to a matching object (e.g. "lemon") wins a point. Whoever has 5 points first wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Chang'an
boardgame.description:
During the Tang dynasty, Chang'an was one of the largest cities in the world. It was a cosmopolitan urban center with thousands of travelers exploring it. As an important urbanist, compete against other players to build the best districts of Chang'an and to get the favors of the court.

Players will carefully project their plans by placing cards on the top part of their personal boards (the gates). Then they will move them into the city districts to build amazing buildings and to welcome influential characters in the neighborhood. Every new card built into the districts will provide players with different types of privileges and a certain number of victory points.

During your turn, you perform only one of the three main actions: research, play and/or move cards on the gates to produce resources and activate character effects, or build.

The game ends as soon as a player gets nine or more cards built in the districts of their City board (cards at the gates are not considered).

The player with the most victory points will be declared the best urbanist of Chang’an.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stealing the Throne
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

A thousand years ago, we built twelve giant mecha to fight a cataclysmic war. We called them Thrones. Ten survived that great war: ancient weapons with storied histories of battle and betrayal, but also symbols of dominance and entitlement. Possession of a Throne bestows wealth, power, and dominion over whole star systems.

That's why you're going to steal one.

Stealing the Throne is a tabletop roleplaying game of exciting mecha heist action for 3-5 players. It’s GMless, and requires absolutely zero prep to play. In just a few hours you’ll build a Throne, a titanic mech with a thousand years of drama-filled history. You’ll devise the elaborate security systems that protect it, and then play to find out how your crew of thieves take them apart.

A mecha heist rpg / 3-5 players / GMless / 1-3 hours / zero-prep

boardgame.name: ハーメルンケイブ (HAMELN CAVE)
boardgame.description:
ハーメルンケイブ (HAMELN CAVE) is a 2 player co-operative game from Japan. Following the story from Carta Marina (カルタマリナ), the pirates find themselves in a cursed cave. Working together, they can escape before the cave collapses on them.

The Lion Pirates, who continued their voyage to break the captain's curse, finally find the Devil's Flute in Hamelin's Cave. But no sooner had they heard the sound than the cave began to crumble and the ghosts of former pirates boarded the ship.

Hameln Cave is a two-player co-operative trick-taking game. Players read each other's intentions, issue cards, defend the ship while fighting ghosts, and try to find a way out. Will you be able to escape from the crumbling cave in one piece?

崩れゆく洞窟から脱出する、2人用協力トリテ。 船長の呪いを解くため、 航海を続けていたリオン海賊団は、 ついに、ハーメルンの洞窟で「悪魔の笛」を見つけ出します。 しかしその音色が響くやいなや、洞窟は音を立て崩れだし かつて海賊だった亡霊たちが船に乗り込んできたのです。 ハーメルンケイブは2人用の協力トリックテイキングゲームです。 プレイヤーはお互いの意図を読んでカードを出し、 亡霊と戦いながら船を守り、出口を目指して進んでいきます。 あなたたちは、崩れゆく洞窟から無事に脱出することができるでしょうか。

publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Saga: Age of Hannibal
Saga: l'âge d'Hannibal
boardgame.description:
SAGA - Age of Hannibal is a Saga supplement that covers the three Punic Wars between Rome and Carthage that took place between 264 and 146 BC.
This Universe includes six factions - some of which include multiple variants - each with its own Battle Board, history, Legendary Units, and special rules.

As well as these factions, you will find an array of mercenaries who can join your warband, as well as a system of Ruses which allow you to personalise your warband by granting specific advantages or chances to deal treacherous low blows to your enemies.

Finally, the supplement ends with Epic Saga, an entirely new way of playing Saga that allows you to play games with warbands of 12 to 18 points on each side. Now you can recreate the greatest battles of antiquity on your table! This game mode includes special rules and a unique method of setting up the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Interplanetary: Supply Drop – Expansion 1
boardgame.description:
This first expansion for Interplanetary, titled Supply Drop, simply adds additional components which are added to the base game's pool of these components. Material of the following types is added:


more directives cards, which increase the variety of the player's goals and thus the number of possible campaign deck configurations
additional parts, allowing the player to construct new installations with fresh boons and to bestow new abilities to one's spacecraft
additional outposts, increasing their number from 4 to 6, thus allowing for new tactics in a playthrough
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Interplanetary: A giant hop for Squeakind

boardgame.name: Hide Your Nuts
boardgame.description:
Hide Your Nuts is a strategic, yet easy-to-learn card game that is bound to make you laugh. Take turns hiding your nuts until one player prevails! It is a fast-moving, fun, and easily portable game. Perfect for traveling, a game night with friends, or a hilarious ice breaker for that first time meeting the in-laws.

On their turn, players use cards to hide their nuts or steal nuts from other players, as well as use weapons and the weather to turn the tide in your favor.
2-3 Player Game: Be the first player to "hide" 15 nuts in your hiding spots
4-6 Player Game: Be the first player to "hide" 10 nuts in your hiding spots

Hide Your Nuts is intended for ages 13+. It is mostly kid friendly in design, but has a lot of adult humor.

boardgame.name: White Hat
boardgame.description:
White Hat pits 1-6 players against each other, as they try to prove their worth as a hacker, picking holes in the World’s toughest security measures, to ensure the protection of sensitive data. At its heart, the game employs a trick-taking mechanic that incorporates many additional elements not found in regular trick-taking games, thus creating numerous twists and turns every round. White Hat comes with separate, dedicated solo and 2-player modes.

As the players attempt to prove their worth, they will attempt to win tricks by playing cards from their hand. If they win a trick they can then move one of their hats on the board through the maze of FBI servers, internet cafes, and digital tracers in order to reach the Critical Asset and end the game. However, players should not always rush to the end as points are scored at the end of each round depending on what spaces their hats are on, and the lowest score is the winner.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: White Hat: Special White Hat Promo Card

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Terror at Wulf's Head: PFRPG 1st Edition Addendum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a conversion addendum of Terror at Wulf's Head by Frog God Games. That product is required to use this addendum.

Terror at Wulf’s Head is an adventure set in the Northlands of the Lost Lands’ setting. Ken Spencer, creator of the Northlands and prolific contributor to the growing opus of the Lost Lands , brings you a tale of  Viking fury, unearthed terrors, and a rescue mission across untamed wilderness. Of course, the heroes will discover deeper secrets along the Savage River: family squabbles, hidden ruins of the long dead Andøvan, greedy jarls, and spiders. So many spiders. Gliftenflyt, the Huscarl of Spiders, has awakened, and her children run rampant!

boardgame.name: Allie Gator
boardgame.description: In Allie Gator, cards are placed as cleverly as possible, with special cards bringing additional fun. Simple rules to start right away.

boardgame.name: Hobgoblin War Camp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #48 Hobgoblin War Camp provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the hobgoblon war camps in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Wurmtongue
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

To kill a wurm

It is said that the lindwurm Fangshake is the brood of the great Othwehügg and that Fangshake was born in a dark and wet burrow filled with bones and skulls from many heroes. The people in Heorhall have worshipped the lindwurm for more than 160 years and the myth about the great serpent has spread across the country. But now, it’s about to change. Fangshake has started to kill and it’s a time for heroes to stop him.

Wurmtongue is designed for 4-6 level 3 characters. You do not need anything more than this module to enjoy the story, but if you wish to enjoy Trudvang Adventures to the fullest, make sure you get the Trudvang Adventures Hero Companion and Trudvang Adventures Setting Companion.

boardgame.name: Wildheart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wildheart thirsts for blood

The adventure Wildheart is the story of an enchanted forest that was once good, but got the taste of dragon blood and became dark and evil. Anyone can enter the forest, but no one leaves without paying a great tribute. It is a tale about old forgotten places, mysterious encounters, trolls and lindwurms – not to mention the first encounter with the great frost giant Blodughadda!

Wildheart is best suited for a group of four to six 3rd-5th level adventurers of varying archetypes. You do not need anything more than this module to enjoy the story, but if you wish to enjoy Trudvang Adventures to the fullest, make sure you get the Trudvang Adventures Hero Companion and Trudvang Adventures Setting Companion.

The original Swedish version of the adventure was hailed as “one of the best adventures of all time” shortly after its release.

boardgame.name: Setting Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spin tales of myths and heroes

Trudvang Adventures is the 5E adaption of Trudvang Chronicles.
The Setting Companion holds everything you need to inspire and weave adventures and campaigns in the world of Trudvang.

This book is essential for all Game Masters, where you will find rules for traveling, hunting, information about the rich world of Trudvang, bestiary and much more.

boardgame.name: Hero Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brave the dangers of Trudvang

The Hero Companion contains rules and inspiration for players to create their own characters and play in the realm of Trudvang.

This book is an essential reference for all players and game masters, containing rules for character creation, spells, combat, and much more.

boardgame.name: Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood: Bruder Tuck in Gefahr
boardgame.description:
Have you successfully completed all the previous adventures of Robin Hood?

Four new tasks await Robin Hood and his companions in the expansion Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood: Bruder Tuck in Gefahr. Unknown warriors attack in the West, and old adversaries become bitter enemies once again. Friar Tuck will support the heroes with his special abilities.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

boardgame.name: Andor Junior: Die Gefahr aus dem Schatten
boardgame.description: In Andor Junior: Die Gefahr aus dem Schatten, an expansion for Andor Junior, you protect the inhabitants of Andor from a dangerous Wardrak. To do so, you have to face new tasks and exciting battles.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: CovidParty!
boardgame.description:
Strategy card game.
Your goal is to accumulate as many points as possible by keeping the Virulence of the epidemic as low as possible, and through Missions carried out during the game. Draw and play humorous Development Cards to build your own strategy to resist the epidemic!

On their turn, players roll a dice to determine the evolution of the epidemic, then draw cards, and choose which cards to play to develop their country in accordance with their strategy. It is the intensity of the epidemic in a player's country that determines how many resources he/she will have to play cards during this turn.

Players try to accumulate points by developing certain abilities through playing cards. These abilities can help them slow the epidemic and reduce its intensity, or carry out missions. Both make the player gain points at the end of the game.

A game lasts 6 months, one month in the game being represented by a turn played by all players (so each player plays 6 turns). The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

listing.notes: More information and order at: https://www.covidpartygame.com/

boardgame.name: Kyojuu in the Dark
boardgame.description:
Kyojuu in the Dark is a strategic memory game about uniting a mythical island under your clan. Four clans make up the island: Rock, Water, Forest, and Earth.

In the darkness, quiet battles rage, with Lords, Warriors, Farmers, and even Children playing their part. Loyal as dogs, the towering Kyojuu fight alongside human masters. These mythical creatures protect their clans with unmatched strength. Remembering former times of peace, the Kyojuu are powerless in the presence of Children.

To start the game, each player places their 9 pieces face down within their designated 3x3 home area. Once placed onto the board, these pieces cannot be flipped over again except when attacking, being attacked, or by the special use of an action card. Each turn, players decide whether to roll and advance their pieces, battle another player, “pinch”, or instead play an action card. When attacking, players reveal the face of one of their pieces that is next to an opposing player's piece. The opponent then reveals their face, and the lower-ranked piece gets removed from the board. The only way to oust a Kyojuu from the board is to “pinch”, which is when two Children from any clan surround a Kyojuu. This move can be made at any point in the game. Through battles and card play, each player’s ultimate goal is to reach the center square of an opponent’s 3x3 square home territory. The first player that lands on the center square of an opponent’s territory is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: バックハンダー (Backhander)
boardgame.description:
バックハンダー (Backhander) is a trick-taking game from Japan. It follows on from the designer's previous game インヴァージョン (!nversion), and takes a theme of an illegal casino run by gangsters. The player who wins the most money loses the game, because they get picked up by the police. So the real winner is the player with the second highest score.

Before play starts, a line of cards is laid out (similar to !nversion), and this dictates the lead suit for each trick. However, players can alter the line by paying bribes. In this way, players can win tricks unexpectedly.
user summary

boardgame.name: Adventure Games: Expedition Azcana
boardgame.description:
Explore places, combine items, and experience stories in Adventure Games, a series of co-operative games from German publisher KOSMOS. In each of these titles, players are presented with a mysterious story that they must unravel over the course of play. Working together, players explore common areas, talk to people, look for clues, and combine various items to reveal the secret of the story. Depending on what decisions the players make, the course of history changes and there is no going back!

Unlike the co-operative EXIT: The Game series, titles in this series focus on the telling and discovery of the story with no time pressure. That said, many different paths can be experienced during play, with more than one correct resolution to the story waiting to be discovered. Each title consists of three chapters, each taking about 75 minutes to play. Nothing is destroyed, so the games can be played multiple times.

In Adventure Games: Expedition Azcana, you will travel to somewhere new...

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Battlesector
boardgame.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Battlesector is a fast-paced turn-based strategy game set in the grimdark universe of the 41st Millenium. Pick your force, develop your army, field mighty heroes and fight for victory using superior strategy, awesome abilities, and devastating weaponry.

Warhammer 40,000: Battlesector is a fast-paced turn-based strategy game set in the grimdark universe of the 41st Millenium. Pick your force, develop your army, field mighty heroes and fight for victory using superior strategy, awesome abilities, and devastating weaponry.

Age of Crimson Dawn

Experience an epic twenty mission single-player campaign that explores the aftermath of the Devastation of Baal. Help Sergeant Carleon and his allies purge the Tyranid infestation on Baal Secundus, and preserve the honour of the noble Blood Angels.

Skirmish Mode

Fight across the surface of Baal on maps of your choosing and select either the Blood Angels or the Tyranids in the Skirmish mode. Completely customize your army list by picking your units, heroes and their loadouts.

Forge Your Armies

Command iconic units like the Sanguinary Priest, the Librarian Dreadnought, and the Hive Tyrant to annihilate your foes. Use over 60 abilities and 50 weapons to orchestrate your opponent’s bloody demise.

Build Momentum

ach faction has a unique Momentum system that can result in a Surged unit. Units that Surge are able to string together superhuman chains of actions, or use the opportunity to further upgrade their abilities.

Call In Air Support

Use Command Points to call in faction-specific air support abilities. The Blood Angels Stormraven can obliterate xenos with a missile barrage, or deep strike a unit of veteran Assault Marines behind enemy lines. Meanwhile, the Tyranid Harpy can devastate the enemy defenses with its Sonic Screech, or scatter the battlefield with its deadly Spore Mines.

Face Your Friends On The Battlefield

With live and asynchronous multiplayer, and hotseat modes available, there’s no excuse not to take your friends to war.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Tempestfall
boardgame.description:
Descend in thunderous Tempestfall and deliver justice in the name of Sigmar. Walk the realm of death and lead your brethren to utter victory in this VR-exclusive Warhammer game. Wield iconic weapons of a Lord-Arcanum to combat hordes of Nighthaunt using motion-based abilities and magic.

Become a mighty Lord-Arcanum, wielder of storm magic, and lead a Stormcast Eternal task force to recover your brethren’s lost souls. Walk the lands of Shyish, discover the secrets of Death, and battle forces of Nighthaunt in Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Tempestfall.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: コルドロン15～魔女の大釜～ (Cauldron 15 ~Witch's Cauldron~)
boardgame.description:
コルドロン15～魔女の大釜～ (Cauldron 15 ~Witch's Cauldron~) is a trick-taking card game from Japan. Players are witches bringing different ingredients to brew up potions.

Play follows the normal method for tricks. However, players are trying to reach but not exceed a total of 15. The cards players earn from winning tricks depend on the total value of the trick. If it is under or on 15, that's okay, but going over 15 causes trouble.

Further, if the player's final score is over 15, they cannot win. But by obtaining all five ingredients, a player can nuetralise the potion and discard to alter their score.

The publisher has put English rules online.
user summary

listing.notes: Open and played once. Willing to ship in a rigid box or padded envelope, buyer's choice.

boardgame.name: Buffalo Wings: Expansion Rules kit
boardgame.description:
The Buffalo Wings Expansion Kit expands coverage of the "Winter War" and "Continuation War" between Finland and the USSR, sometimes independent and then as part of WW2. The title comes from a plane -- the Brewster Buffalo -- which was woefully unsuccessful when used by US and British forces, but which the Finns adapted into a very useful fighter, which they nicknamed the "Sky Pearl." (Yeah, they liked it a lot!)

The original Buffalo Wings issue game is popular because it serves as an 'intro' game to the entire "Fighting Wings" series -- games from J.D. Webster that are among the most popular air battle board games of all time. This expansion kit allows folks who want to get deeper and into more complexity with their games to do so while still using the intro rules found in the base Buffalo Wings game itself.

To that end, we've included more "Aircraft Data Cards" (the handy charts which capture everything that makes one plane different from another), plus the bombers in the expansion game now perform as individual planes (they are rather generic in the base game).

Best of all, the new map and ADC cards are still fully compatible with the entire Fighting Wings series of games!
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Wargame Expansion Nominee

boardgame.name: I, Napoleon
boardgame.description:
I, Napoleon is a solitaire historical role-playing card game in which you step into the boots of Captain Buonoparte (as he still was) in the year 1793. Louis XVI has just gone to the guillotine, the brothers Robespierre control the destiny of France, and all Europe has joined French Royalists to take down France, end the Revolution, and restore peace and safety for the hereditary principles that have underlain society for 1000 years.

As an ambitious but unknown young artillery officer, who speaks French with a Corsican accent, you would seem to be an unlikely agent of destiny. Can you harness a brilliant mind, titanic energies, and a sometimes terrifying charisma to leave your mark on history? Or will you die a minor footnote in the story of France?

boardgame.name: Galaxy Defenders: Feldherr Inlay
boardgame.description:
They're already here! And they're not friendly! As part of a secret elite squad, it's up to you and the other agents to protect the world from the alien invasion. But who will take care of miniatures and game material after the mission? We have accepted this order and developed this foam tray set, custom-made for your Galaxy Defenders board game box.

The foam tray set contains:

1 foam tray for miniatures (BQMECW035BO)
1 foam tray for game material (BQMECX045BO)
1 suitable foam topper

All miniatures of the game find their place clearly arranged on the upper tray. 28 compartments, cut precisely to fit the miniatures, ensure that they are optimally protected against damages. Agent Chromium, Agent Thorium and their other three teammates are as safe here as the miniatures of the Aliens. Each figure is completely surrounded by foam. This ensures that even the most bumpy transport cannot damage the colors of painted figures. It also keeps sensitive parts, such as Agent Mercury's blade, from bending or breaking.

Additionally on this mat: six hexagonal compartments for dice.

The lower mat, with 21 compartments, helps you to sort the game material. There are 2 card compartments, with finger-wide recess for easy removal. Of course your cards will fit here sleeved as well.

The Agent Profile Sheets are assigned a correspondingly large tray. The other hexagonal markers can also be sorted into correspondingly shaped compartments. This makes sorting easier and ensures not only a quick overview. It also keeps them from slipping around during transport. The other compartments are for additional markers, tokens and the remaining dice.

Game maps, Rulebook and the Storybook are placed on the foam topper.

The lid of the board game box protrudes approx. 1-2 cm.

The foam trays have the following dimensions:
1 mat: 395 mm x 270 mm x 45 mm height (35 mm usable height + 10 mm foam base).
1 mat: 395 mm x 270 mm x 35 mm height (25 mm usable height + 10 mm foam base).
high-quality, fine pored foam
CFC-free
chlorine and acid free
Made in Germany

boardgame.name: 秘密のオークションハウス (Secret Auction House)
boardgame.description:
秘密のオークションハウス (Secret Auction House) is an auction game from Japan with some hidden elements. Players bid simultaneously with money cards in a series of auctions. But matching bids cancel each other (butting) in the manner of What the Heck?. So the auction can be won by a player with a low bid.

All bid cards are discarded, until the player exhausts their hand or spends a special token, to refill their hand. By careful choice, a player can know what cards other players have, and manage their own bids successfully.

Players spend cash when they win bids on auction items. Not running out of money too soon is a challenge.

Further, players have two secret cards of winning conditions they want to meet, such as winning different values or combos of items. For example, winning two pairs of items scores 5 bonus points, or a run of items valued 1-3 to get 3 bonus points.

At the end of the auction rounds, the player with the most points wins.
user summary

boardgame.name: Mysteriously Missing & Merrily Met
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysteriously Missing & Merrily Met is as set of optional tables for Old-School Essentials and is compatible with similar clones of the Original, B/X or BECMI editions of the classic fantasy role-playing game.

These tables answer the question: "Where have you been?", for when a player misses a session, explaining where their character has been and what they've been doing.

The set features three tables:

Last Seen in Town
Last Seen in the Wilderness
Last Seen in a Dungeon
They provide an instant retroactive story to explain why a character disappeared and was not around during the last session.

These tables aim at providing interesting events to inject more story into the campaign. Sometimes the results are simple and bear little or no consequence; sometimes a result may produce a significant change in the character’s story.

boardgame.name: Poetry for Neanderthals: More Cards Box 1
boardgame.description:
More Cards Box 1 is the first expansion to Poetry for Neanderthals.

Poetry for Neanderthals is a competitive word-guessing game where you can only give clues by speaking in single syllables. So, instead of saying "broccoli," you'd say something like "green thing you eat for live long and have good health." If you mess up and use a big word, such as "vegetable," you get bopped on the head with a NO !Stick and you lose points.

The goal of the game is to score the most points by correctly interpreting words and phrases. The chosen Poet starts off the game with a Poetry Card and tries to get their teammates to say the listed word, using only words with one syllable within a 90-second time limit.

The box contains 500 new double sided cards. That’s 2000 new words and phrases to use with Poetry for Neanderthals.

boardgame.name: Showcase
boardgame.description:
2 player traditional card game in two phases. In the first phase play 13 tricks to draft a hand of cards for round two. The winner of a trick take a face up display card into their Showcase row, while the loser takes the top card of talon into their hand unseen. Then another display card is dealt. After thirteen tricks, in the second phase, the last thirteen tricks are played out exposed using the previously won cards in each's Showcase row.

There are several unique constraints that guide the flavor and strategy of the game: Phase 1 is played "All trump": a player has to follow suit but if they can't and play another suit that card automatically wins. Only these ruffed tricks count as points in the first phase. In the second phase, the player with the least points in the first phase gets to choose trump (among any of the four suits, no-trump, or a repeat of the all-trump of the first phase). All tricks count 1 point in the second phase. The other interesting constraint is that if a player leads a suit that the other player has in their showcase row, the other player must follow suit. Otherwise they may play any card.

boardgame.name: フエルトリテ (Fuerto Rite)
boardgame.description:
フエルトリテ (Fuerto Rite) is a trick-taking card game from Japan. The game box shows a sail boat on Lake Ashi, which looks strangely familiar.

In Fuerto Rite, players follow normal trick-taking rules, but with some changes. Players draw more cards as they play, so ending with more hand cards than when they started.

Further, players draft cards with their neighbours during the game. This mix of drawing, drafting and hand management gives the game a different feel.

Scoring is based on which cards players win. But only the smallest set counts, so players must be careful to balance their winnings.
user summary

boardgame.name: Ship Repair Business Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need to put in for some repairs? Give that repair place a name the players will remember. Download d66 Ship Repair Business Names and have a name for that quick fix they need.

13 Afterburner's Speedy Fixes
22 BOSS: Bob Otto's Ship Service
52 SafeScreen Ship Windows

boardgame.name: Planetary Holidays
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every planet is going to have its own holidays that are not celebrated anywhere else. Why not have the players land just in time for a holiday diversion. d66 Planetary Holiays gives you 36 names and ideas of holidays you can use in your name game session.

14 Authority Day, marking the execution of rioters and the silencing of resistance
25 Dragon Ship Festival, ships are decorated as dragons and fly around
46 Incorporation, day marking the start of the corporation

boardgame.name: Jooky Jooky
boardgame.description:
Specially designed for families with children ages 6 and up, Jooky Jooky is a game about an intrusive insect that players will delight in chasing through 4 different challenges: labyrinth, search & find, majority and checkup.

Each player, armed with a fly swatter, must take a good look at the challenge card in play and be the first to correctly complete the challenge, either by squashing Jooky with their flyswatter or by picking her up. The fastest player wins the card. The win conditions are adapted to the players’ age.

This game, which relies on speed, dexterity and observation skills, can easily be adapted to the age and abilities of its players.

Although Jooky Jooky may seem a bit childish at first glance, don’t be fooled, as both children and adults will have a great time! The whole family will enjoy playing this simple yet lively game.

boardgame.name: Zombie Bus: Les touristes
boardgame.description:
Tourists do not count as an extra zombie card around the bus.

When they arrive, place 5 Injury tablets on the tourists. Remove one at the end of each turn.

As long as there is at least one patch left on the map, you can save these tourists by assigning them 4 action sides in a single turn. Win the card (place it under your hero).

As soon as there are no more pastilles on the map, tourists turn into zombies. They now count as an additional zombie card around the bus that you can no longer release or damage.

Note: if there is no more cheerleader to release, the tourists must also be released or wait for them to transform for the game to end.


Les touristes ne comptent pas comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus.A leur arrivée, placez 5 pastilles Blessures sur les touristes. Retirez-en une à la fin de chaque tour.

Tant qu'il reste au-moins une pastille sur la carte, vous pouvez sauvez ces touristes en leur affectant 4 faces actions en un seul tour. Remportez la carte (placez-la sous votre héros).

Dès qu'il n'y a plus de pastille sur la carte, les touristes se transforment en zombies. Ils comptent désormais comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus que vous ne pouvez plus ni libérer ni blesser.

Note : s'il n'y a plus de cheerleader à libérer, il faut aussi libérer les touristes ou attendre qu'ils se transforment pour que la partie prenne fin.

boardgame.name: Alfred the Great: The London Campaign, 885 AD (Volume 5)
boardgame.description:
Alfred in this period commenced both the re-structuring of his Army and his Burh building program in earnest.

In 885 a Viking army that had been active in Frankia sailed and attacked Rochester, a pivotal Town/Burh with its confluence of roads and river running thru it. The Vikings of East Anglia, under Alfred’s longtime nemesis Guthrum, now saw an opportunity with their Viking Allies to strike back at their Saxon antagonists.

Lundene had been held as a defensive base by the Vikings since 871AD; by reinforcing the existing walls in the old Roman town they commanded a strategic asset which controlled the Temes River from both trading and military perspectives. If Alfred was to achieve his goal of an Anglo- Saxon England than this would have to rectified.

Kings are of great importance in this series of games. When they are leading the warriors in combat your moral and thereby fighting ability is increased, without them it is weakened. Of course, the loss of a King in battle can also mean the loss of your cause. However, in this era risks must be taken to take and hold the crown. Saddle your horse and grab your sword for the King has called you to war…for God and Wessex!

Each copy of Alfred the Great vol. 5: The London Campaign is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 hex map sheets.
Two sheets of 267 (total) single-sided, un-mounted counters.
Two Battle Boards.
Two Supply Tracks.
Nine pages of rules including designer notes and examples of play.

boardgame.name: Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020
boardgame.description: An operational design by Greg Porter covering the Nagorno-Karabahk War of 2020. You'll command formations of T-90 tanks, BMP-equipped mechanized infantry, drones, cruise missiles, and squadrons of attack aircraft as you simulate the war between Armenia and Azerbaijan, which took place in the fall of 2020. Units represent battalions grouped into brigades. A game of Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020 will probably take a little less than 10 passes through the deck, so it will run a little faster than the actual war.

boardgame.name: Aerospace Engineers' Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Aerospace engineering is the art and science of designing spacecraft and starships. This practice encompasses a range of craft from sleek surface-to-orbit craft to lumbering bulk carriers, and the aerospace engineer is key to their design.

Spacecraft and starships are the lifeblood of exploration and commerce. They are also vital in the defence and acquisition of colony worlds and the economies that rely on them. The stutterwarp drive provides the key to interstellar travel. Rather than taking decades or even centuries to reach the stars, stutterwarp reduces that time to days. The most difficult part remains escaping a planetary gravity well; once in orbit, you are halfway to anywhere.

The Aerospace Engineers’ Handbook provides everything you need to design not just the ships of human space, but also the vessels of the alien Kaefers, Pentapods, and Sung. It also covers the design of drones, space stations, and alternative means of achieving orbit.

Alongside this, there is further information on those living in space, the outsiders who abandoned planets for the stars, along with the major space powers and their fleets. The Aerospace Engineers’ Handbook also contains a selection of drones and ships, for Travellers to command, fight, or run away from, with advanced rules for spacecraft combat.

Requires the use of the 2300AD box set.

boardgame.name: Master Word Pocket Version
boardgame.description: This miniature, abbreviated version of Master Word was included as a promo in Game Trade Magazine #249. It contains two word cards and a QR code that links to an online rulebook.

boardgame.name: Field of War micro card game
boardgame.description:
Field of War is an asymmetric game for 3 players. Quick to setup and play, but deep in strategy and escalating consequences. 2 players will fight over the territory playing command cards, recruiting troops and rolling dice to attack each other. While a third player will try to farm his fields while dodging bombs in a worker placement and resource management style of game. Wait enough time, and the farm workers will raise against its oppressors.

On a turn, the farm player will use their workers to do an action of one of the available fields. Those actions allow him to gather resources, recruit more workers, build a barricade to peacefully trade with the surrounding troops. The army players however, will pick a command card from his hand to choose actions and march over the fields of the farmers, shoot any enemy rolling dice, recruit more troops or upgrade them.

Both sides will collide and at any time, the farmer player can decide to turn intro a revolutionary and fight the armies back.

The game ends when the farmers gather enough resources to pay for mercenaries. Or when the armies eliminate the opponents or troops arrive at the opponent's command base.
