boardgame.name: Vadmentők
boardgame.description:
Animals need brave rescuers now. Defy a thousand dangers, help free the protected animals, take them back to the savannah and the primeval forest! You will have to deal with evil hunters along the way. You have to cross the Nile, which is teeming with wild hippos. You are flying over the barren Sahara. You can only count on the help of caravans. Who will be the first to bring back and feed all five animals?

Game rules: The object of the game is to return the animals to their habitats, the winner is the first to return five animals. They rescue an animal at the camp site by taking an animal card with them. They roll the dice, choosing their own route to get the water and food that will be right for the animal on the way, and then take it back to its natural habitat. When entering a caravan field, we get help cards, when entering a poaching field, we have to draw obstruction cards - unless we have handcuffs, in which case we can take the poach to the hunter.

boardgame.name: Ja Ci pokażę Junior
boardgame.description:
Ja ci pokażę JUNIOR is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players. It contains cards with items, animals, emotions and professions.

In a game, one of a team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words from the cards as possible.

There is way of showing in one side of the card and picture on the other side of the card. One player turns around top card and has to show or tell the word in a special way (i.e. only showing with no words or by using only sounds). If the team guesses they get the card as a point. If nobody can´t guess the word and time is up, next team plays.

When the preprepared deck runs out the team with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Endangered: Campaign Cards
boardgame.description:
The Campaign is a series of up to 5 games of Endangered. Each game must use a different species scenario. Winning a game makes the next game harder, while losing a game makes the next game easier!

Before each game, randomly draw one Campaign card (that hasn't already been used in this Campaign). Each card describes conditions dependent on whether you won or lost the previous game. After reading the condition, select your species Scenario and difficulty, and apply the condition.

Track your wins and losses. If you achieve 3 wins before you suffer 3 losses, your campaign is a success! If you suffer 3 losses first, sadly you have failed in your mission. Good luck!

boardgame.name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters
boardgame.description:
Ancient Blood - The Order of Vampire Hunters is a cooperative story-driven game for 1 to 4 players that can be played as solo mode, as standalone games, or as a campaign. Choose a story and begin your journey. Be brave and wise, as every choice you make along your path will impact the game world. The wrong choice could awaken your most hidden fears. Fight side by side with your fellow hunters like never before using combo attacks, get help from locals using your skills, and find all the clues that will lead you to the master of each Vampires' clan, The Elder Lord.

Ancient Blood is a prequel to The Order of Vampire Hunters. It features some game mechanics inspired by the old game, but it is a new game. It is not compatible with the previous one, since Ancient Blood is a story-driven game in which your decisions will influence how the game develops and the end of the story. The new game features exploration, crafting, resource management, and leveling up. This time your decisions will change the story of the game, so be prepared to deal with the consequences of your choices.

Can you defeat the Elder Lords?

boardgame.name: Endangered: Celebrity
boardgame.description: A new role is available for Endangered. The Celebrity mini-expansion comes with a role board, 14 cards, 3 custom dice, and 2 role powers. Change up your game by substituting a celebrity for a role in the core Endangered game. This was a Kickstarter exclusive with Endangered: New Species.

boardgame.name: F**k. The Game
boardgame.description:
This is a great social card game that will f**k with your head by using a hysterically tricky combination of colours and swear words.

Players take turns to flip over a card and shout out what they see.
Depending on your card, you might say its background colour, its text colour or a swear word. Keep playing until someone f**ks up and is forced to pick up all the cards. The winner is the first player to get rid of their cards.

It sounds simple, but the cards use a psychological phenomenon – the Stroop effect – known to mess with your head and delay your brain’s response. Players can’t help but f**k up, sending the group into fits of laughter.

Once you’ve mastered the basics, you can take the game to a whole new level with more rules, more strategy and you can even create your own rules.

boardgame.name: Relic: Playtest Kit
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The playest kit for Relic contains condensed rules and an introductory scenario, and it's intended to give an early overview of how the game works. As a playtest kit, some of the rules are not fully tested or in their final form, and as a whole the kit assumes some level of knowledge about games such as Apocalypse World and Blades in the Dark.

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: El Ojo de Itzamna
Jonathan Eaton's Houses of Treasure: Itzamna's Eye
boardgame.description:
Jonathan Eaton, billionaire and owner of Vestigium Industries, combines ruling the biggest corporation on earth with adventuring in temples and labyrinths. He leaves everyone perplexed when he announces his retirement. And even more so when he explains how he will chose his successor: like a modern day Willy Wonka he challenges you and your friends to participate in the contest of the century. The winner gets all the Vestigium stocks and will be the richest person on earth. Are you in?

This is the second part of the series.

listing.notes: Title: Jonathan Eaton's Houses of Treasure: Itzamna's Eye Publisher: Jumbo Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Escape Game avec Maelys
boardgame.description:
Help Maëlys and Lucien to get out of the castle before midnight, by solving the puzzles in each room. Hurry, because the clock is ticking, but keep your eyes peeled for clues! Hours of play ahead to have fun all year round!

For 1 to 4 players. From 7 years old. A superb big game: 1 large castle to assemble, 180 puzzle cards, 9 envelopes, 1 red filter, 1 mirror card, 1 Maëlys and Lucien pawn, 1 magnifying glass, 1 clock, 1 hourglass, 1 notepad.

boardgame.name: Elf King Red
boardgame.description:
Elf King Red is a fastplay game using the Lucid Eye Engine, set in the Elf realms of the Isles of Eas, previously seen in The Red Book of The Elf King & Troll Wars. Ownership of those two books is not essential as this is a standalone product, but they contain lots of colourful background and setting information which some players may find useful. Elf King Red uses similar sized armies to Savage Core, which is around 7 figures or so, seven being a mystical number for the Elves. The game has been written to provide a playable experience with a low commitment entry point.

This free rulebook provides all the basic rules needed to play and includes stats for all of the Factions, otherwise known as Circles in Elf King Red.

So once again strap on your Faeblade of Starmetal, don your Glamourbound Armour and prepare your magick, for Red War and The Fall of All.

boardgame.name: Giftbringer
Wikinger-Wichteln
boardgame.description:
Santa has his hands full and Christmas is just around the corner. What is worse, all his Elven helpers aren’t well. In such circumstances Santa asked for help from his closest friends - the Vikings. You are the leader of one of the mighty Viking Horde which came to the shores of The Grateful Island. Your goal is to visit the local town homes and – obviously - deliver presents. Then you can in turn collect the tokens of gratitude left there for Santa!

Giftbringer is a roll&write game. To play you’ll need 4 six-sided dice, the Rulebook and for each placer a pen/pencil and a Player Sheet. Before the start of the game randomly determine the Merry Leader (rolling player).

The game itself consists of 10 Rounds. At the beginning of each Round the Merry Leader rolls the 4 six-sided dice. All players write down the roll results in the slots for the given Round on their Player Sheets. The results of the roll are the numbers that the players can use that Round. For each die roll the player can cross off a die symbol on one of the Vikings, one of the Roads or one of the Houses. Alternatively he can use one or two of those die rolls for a Special Action (Santa's Blessing), but each Special Action can only be used once per game.

Initially each player has to Recruit a Viking - without one he cannot Visit the town itself. This also applies if a Viking already delivered all his Presents and the player has to Recruit another one. After having the first available Viking the player has to choose one of the Ships on the map to start his journey (this cannot be changed later, even with a new Viking). From that ship he can then start crossing the die symbols on Roads and Houses to visit them. He cannot jump over Houses or Roads and can only progress to an unvisited Road/House, adjacent to any of his already visited Roads/Houses.

When a player crosses the die symbol on a Road segment leading to a House (including crossing a potential die symbol on the House itself), he visits the House. Then he has to cross the required number of Presents on his Viking (and the House) in order to get the token of gratitude available there (which he writes down under his Viking). Once all gratitude token spaces of a Viking are filled, that Viking has done his job and cannot be used anymore - the player has to Recruit another one. If a Happiness symbol is also present on the House, after delivering the Presents for that House the player marks the next available Happiness token on his track.

After completing the last Round the player with the most points will be the winner of the game. Points are scored for each collected token of gratitude and for the achieved level of Happiness on a given player's Happiness track. Additionally, the final score can be influenced by the number of a given type of collected tokens of gratitude (e.g. 15 points for collecting 8 Cookies).

boardgame.name: Obscure War
boardgame.description:
Obscure War is a tabletop miniature board game in which Warwulf Cabal and Vampyric Cabal fight for the control of Obscure Plane Domains. The game takes place in a contemporary Dark Fantasy universe with a rather spectacular mechanic of Power Cards that interact directly on the Game zone and affect the Characters in game.

You have 3 phases in a Turn : Activation, Power, and Dissolution.

During his/her activation, a Character (miniature) can perform 4 types of Optional actions : Power card Action, movement action, attack action, and control action. Each Cabal activates its Characters one after the other until the activation of all the 8 Characters deployed on the Game zone.

In the Power phase, each Cabal gains 1 Power Point for each Obscure Plane’s Domain it controls.

In the Dissipation phase, all the Power Cards are discarded and placed in the Discard.

To win Obscure War, a Cabal must have the highest Power point score after 3 Turns.

boardgame.name: ABC Miam
boardgame.description:
OBJECT: to fill up the two monsters you own by drawing the right animals.

Each player is the proud owner of 2 monsters! Greedy but difficult monsters, because they only feed on certain letters contained in the names of animals. To try to feed them, you have to draw a card. You then say the name of the animal shown on it. If this name contains one of the letters the monster likes, the monster can be fed. To be full up, it will need 15 calories, i.e. 15 points shown on the cards... Beware of the “indigestion” cards which can make you lose points. The first player to fill their 2 monsters up wins the game!

+++ 2 difficulty levels so players can play at their own pace!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blight Catchers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement for Warlock!, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming, outlines the Blight Catchers who protect the Kingdom from the cults and demon-obsessed followers of the Traitor. The activities of Blight Catchers, Confessors and their organisations and goals are outlined, along with player characters careers and ideas for incorporating Blight Catchers into your game of Warlock. Finally, a sandbox investigative adventure is presented which can be used in a regular Warlock campaign or to kick off a game focused on Blight Catchers and their prey.

boardgame.name: ウチューカイギ (Interspace Conference on Earth)
boardgame.description:
ウチューカイギ (Uchu Kaigi) is a trick-taking game from Japan, about an "interspace conference on Earth".

The players are trying to be selected as the ambassador for an alien conference on Earth. By providing entertainment for the delegates from seven different worlds, a player tries to curry favour. But if they give too much to one of the aliens, they will be penalised for favouritism. They will lose points, and their rivals may gain.

The game follows normal trick-taking rules, players following the colour lead. The cards shows an alien and the amount of hospitality the player is offering. Winning the trick gets the player the host spot and the cards go to their tableau.

Rounds end when a player exhausts their hand. The game end when somebody reaches enough points or enough rounds are played. The player with the most points wins.

However, the different alien races trigger effects, either when the card is played or scored. For example, a player might be forced out of a round, or lose points for having too many cards of one alien. This means players have to make more choices than simply playing high cards.
user summary

boardgame.name: Tech City: City of Cards
boardgame.description:
Tech City is a multi-player, semi-cooperative city building game for 1-6 players. The cards are tiles that are modular representing companies. Card game effects become available as the city expands. Service companies require multiple players to cooperate to jointly build. Each round players add companies to Tech City and players individually score points as they build companies based on pattern matching and board state. 

The Tech Deck is a modern deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker. Cards represent companies in Tech City each with special effects that players can use.

Each round, players get to play a card representing a company to build up Tech City. They score points based on matching cards they play and the board state. Players then get to use effects on any card in Tech City to make each game experience unique and fun.

The game ends after 6 rounds of play. The player(s) with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Dark Deeds Along the Old Coach Road: Til Undeath Do Us Part
Til Undeath Do Us Part
Til Undeath Do Us Part: Dark Deeds Along the Old Coach Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The newlyweds are missing. Something must have happened to them somewhere along the Old Coach Road. Their worried uncle implores the player characters to find out what happened.

The investigation leads the characters to a wrecked coach. Following the trail to an old mausoleum is the start of a harrowing encounter with a new type of undead creature. More than the newlyweds lives hang in the balance.

This adventure uses the Fifth Edition rules and is designed for a party of four characters of Level 1.

Adventure includes information about minicampaign setting: The Old Coach Road.

boardgame.name: Desertfall
Przybycie na pustynię
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 34-page introductory adventure for the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium roleplaying game brings the player characters to Arrakis to prepare for the arrival of House Atreides. Soon after planetfall, the player characters must ensure the official Residency is secure and try to unearth any spies, assassins, or other potential threats that may be lurking in Arrakeen.

Desertfall can be played using the pregenerated characters included, but will work equally well with a new group of player characters from a different House.

This new version of Desertfall has undergone a few small changes since its release as part of the Corebook Preview. We have adjusted the presentation of some characters, but we’ve also taken the opportunity to offer new guidance about adapting this adventure to an ongoing campaign with a House of your own, and included additional notes on how to continue the adventure if some of the sub plots are not resolved.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Hack Aventureros Errantes
boardgame.description: Dungeon Hack Aventureros Errantes is an old school RPG in which you can live great adventures and fight goblins, challenge dragons, decipher strange enigmas, survive in the wild, build kingdoms and even explore other dimensions.

boardgame.name: Stack the Scoops
boardgame.description:
Stack the Scoops is a an award winning ice-cream themed family card game kids and adults can enjoy together! Created to be both fun and educational, Stack the Scoops helps reinforce fundamental math skills while encouraging families to connect through games.

The premise is simple, kids and adults take turns trying to make ice cream sets by collecting a base, scoop, and topping. Different cards are worth different points. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

Kids love the easy playability and the fun images while the strategy plays on classic card game concepts making it recognizable and fun for adults.

boardgame.name: Tiletum
boardgame.description:
In Tiletum, you and fellow players take on the roles of rich merchants traveling throughout Europe, from Flanders to Venice, during the Golden Age of the Renaissance.

You will travel to various cities to acquire trade contracts for wool and iron, as well as a collection of their coats of arms. You must collect the required resources to fulfill contracts, invest in the construction of monumental cathedrals, gain the favor of noble families, and participate in important fairs where your main business occurs. You will also use the services of notable people who will be welcomed into your houses. You will thus gain prestige that will make you the most famous merchant of the Renaissance.

Tiletum is a dice management game in which dice have a dual function: gaining resources and performing actions. A certain number of dice will be rolled each round. On your turn, choose a die to gain the number of corresponding resources equal to the value of the die, then perform the associated action. The power of the action is inversely proportional to the value of the die, so the fewer resources you gain, the more powerful the actions you take and vice versa.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 4: Top 5 Shelf of Shame Games

boardgame.name: Pentaquark: Campaign Mode
boardgame.description:
You've just been hired as the new director of the CERN laboratory. Can you guide your team through six experiments and earn enough grant money to fund future research?

To celebrate the return of Pentaquark, Mike Mullins has designed a campaign mode for the original game.

It uses all Colliders – Pentaquark: Colliders (Kickstarter edition) and Pentaquark: Colliders (BGotMC edition) – (also included in the PNP if you don’t have them) and will keep you on your toes. As if the main game didn’t already do that.

boardgame.name: Balkan Wars: The First Balkan War
boardgame.description:
Relive the First Balkan War in this exciting and quick playing game. Having recently lost Libyan and Adriatic territories to the Italians, the Ottoman Empire has shown its weakness. Serbia, Greece, and Bulgaria now see this as their opportunity to expand and claim the Balkans for themselves. Will you maintain the Empire and hold lands held since the 14th century for the Sultan? Or will you take your rightful lands from the sick man of Europe and secure your place on the Balkan peninsula?

Designed to play quickly and easily, The First Balkan War will allow you to easily teach younger audiences, and anyone knew to board gaming, how to play A&A style games. Move and recruit armies, rolls dice, and conquer the map. For those veterans of A&A, you already own all the pieces you need to play! Just buy the rondel packs and any relevant units you want for a more immersive experience. Test your strategies against each other and determine the fate of the future powder-keg of Europe!

boardgame.name: Hadrian's Wall: Actor
boardgame.description:
6 Promo Cards for Hadrian's Wall + 1 rules card.

6 x Actor (1 per player deck)
Scores for completed performances:
2 = 1VP / 4 = 2VP / 6 = 3VP

New rules:
During Setup, each player adds their new Actor Card into their Draw Pile before shuffling. Rather than drawing 2 Cards each Year, players must now draw 3. They still choose 1 as their Path and 1 as their Prospect. The third, unchosen Card must be placed facedown on top of their Draw Pile, which they will see again in the next Year. In Year 6, the unchosen card can be discarded from the game entirely.

boardgame.name: Slayer Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring Archetypes for The Archivist - The Deadly Fist - The Kingslayer - The Masquerader - The Pious Blade - The Rampager - The Dispenser

A slayer’s job can be a solitary one. Slayers can’t always rely on their party members to match their stealth; it’s hard to surprise a foe when an ally in full plate is clomping along behind you! For this reason, some slayers forgo the study of sneak attacks, since that usually means working in tandem with someone else to flank, and instead focus on solitary methods of taking down their prey. Following are slayer archetypes that employ a variety of other methods such as bombs, hand-to-hand combat, enchantment and illusion magic, rampages, and even a deity-approved sanction pool to defeat their enemies.

boardgame.name: Klix Snap Action Baseball
boardgame.description:
As pitcher and batter, you and your opponent try to outmatch each other. Just like the real thing! This is a cat and mouse contest between pitcher and batter. Both pitcher and batter actively choose either a black chip or white chip for each at-bat. When both have chosen, reveal your choices at the same time. If the colors match, then the batter is OUT. If the colors do not match, the batter gets a HIT. If it is a HIT use the "Snap Action Dice" and reference the chart to see what happened. PLAY BALL!!

The player with the most runs wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Klix Pocket Travel Games (Tiger Electronics)

boardgame.name: Demons of the Abyss: Lords of Chaos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lower Planes are home to many foul and dangerous denizens.

The demon race is particularly dangerous, given their propensity for destruction and the pleasure they gain from corrupting that which is good and lawful.

Formed from the souls of those evil, chaotic souls that succumbed to the worst excesses of sin, these spirits find a new outlet for their destructive desires as embodiments of pure chaos and evil.

Standing above the rank and file of the Abyssal horde are the lords of chaos, from the mysterious moth demons to the mighty fire demon. Descend into the darkest depths to uncover the lords of the Abyssal race, the demon lords, of which Pazuzu is famous.

Uncover new templates for creating spheres-equivalent demons of all levels, including the demon lords. Open the gates to Infinity and unleash the designs and minions of the Sphere’s Bestiary: Demons of the Abyss: Lords of Chaos in the campaign.

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power/Spheres of Might systems

boardgame.name: Amalgamated Idea Dynamics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amalgamated Idea Dynamics (A.I.D.) is a corporation dedicated to expansion of human knowledge and prosperity through science. Founded by nova philanthropist, inventor, and superhero Yuki Yanagi — a.k.a. Doctor Dynamic — A.I.D. works to push humankind’s understanding to new heights while creating innovations that expand the comfort, safety, and prosperity of their partners, clients, and customers. A.I.D. also provides nova security and municipal defense for the city of Madison, Wisconsin, which is home to their corporate headquarters.

Within you will find character sheets and backgrounds for the four members of A.I.D., as well as plot seeds for potential adventures.

boardgame.name: Love Formula: Playmat – Doki Doki Standard
boardgame.description: Beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material, 24.25" X 14.25"

boardgame.name: Love Formula: Playmat – Oversized Doki Doki Setup
boardgame.description: Beautiful oversized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material, 24" x 36'"

Released: January 2020

Thickness: 1.5mm
SKU: PCA702
UPC: 0703558837981

boardgame.name: Love Formula: Playmat – Delicious Food Standard
boardgame.description: Beautiful standard sized playmat, made of a high quality mousepad-like material, 24.25" X 14.25"

boardgame.name: レムレース (Lemures)
boardgame.description:
レムレース (Lemures) is a horror game from Japan. The game can be played solitaire or as a two player co-operative game. The player is exploring a strange fantastic castle, helping souls trapped, and seeking their own way out.

The publisher says:
Is there a place for the soul to return here? The abyss is changing. You will always be exposed to the threat of unknown beings in the castle. Explore the interior of the old castle while rejecting "they".

Since the inside of the castle changes with each play, different developments will come every time. Co-operative play with two people is also possible.

During your exploration, you may find the souls of those who once lived in the castle. Such a soul is already a light in front of the wind, but if you give it power, it will bloom beautiful flowers. On the contrary, if you take power, it will soon die.

You cannot survive in the castle without strong power. Let's create a new technique from Reason and Instinct. There is some danger in learning the art of Instinct. The ending changes depending on whether you follow Reason or Instinct.

If you have been exploring the castle for a long time, you will be oppressed by karma. Karma is a dangerous being that undermines vitality and soul. Be careful, but be quick to explore. The deeper you go into the castle, the more memories of the past will come back ...
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 55)
boardgame.description: In celebration of the release of the Hawkeye series on Disney+ (and yes... I'm SUPER-excited), we are proud to present our November issue of The New Marvel-Phile, featuring all sorts of archers, from popular to obscure! It also features the largest writeup of trick arrows used by the various comic book archers (including those from the distinguished competitor) and a page of standup figures!

boardgame.name: Family Feud Jumbo Card Game: Platinum Edition
boardgame.description:
Survey says ... fun, in a big way! Challenge friends and family to give the top answers to survey questions.
--- Description from box

boardgame.name: Roll Player: 3 Card Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This promo pack adds 3 promo cards to Roll Player and can be used in combination with any of the Roll Player expansions.

Included cards: Cursed Ring, Ring of Charity, and the Cartographer backstory card.


Note: The Cartographer backstory card is included inside every copy of Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale. These cards may not be purchased individually on the Thunderworks Games website, but Cursed Ring and Ring of Charity are available individually through the Boardgamegeek Store (as of 2021) if you already own the Cartographer card.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Roll Player: Cartographer Backstory Promo Card
Roll Player: Ring of Charity Promo Card

listing.notes: Shipping is 5 euros. New in shrink

boardgame.name: Artifact: Expanded Rules
boardgame.description: Expanded rules published in Space Gamer #34 (Dec. 1980) add new weapons and equipment as well as bases and a point system for design your own scenarios.

boardgame.name: Fabula Ultima: Load Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Now that you have played Fabula Ultima: Press Start, you are ready to take the game into your own hands. This document contains advice, ideas and additional rules that will allow you to continue playing with Blair, Cassandra, Edgar and Lavigne for a few sessions!

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Don't Upset The Wookiee!
boardgame.description:
Celebrating some of Chewie's best scenes, this is a fast-paced card game where the Wookiee gets all the glory.

Play a card with an angrier Chewie than the last until he eventually loses it! Complete a set of Wookiees, be the first to lose your cards, or be the last one standing to win after three fun filled rounds!

boardgame.name: Sir Pellinore's Game
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Sir Pellinore's Game was first published in 1978 and is considered a derivative of Tunnels & Trolls. Subsequent editions appeared in 1979 and 1981. The game is discussed at some length in several articles and the book The Elusive Shift by Jon Peterson. Though very obscure and rare, it is considered an important game in the early history of roleplaying.

The 1978 edition's full title is Sir Pellinore's Book of Rules for a Game of Magic Mideval Adventures; the 1979 edition's title is Sir Pellinore's Game, and the 1981 edition's title is Sir Pellinore's Favorite Game.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Sir Pellinore's Book of Rules for a Game of Magic Mideval Adventures

boardgame.name: Real Life Role Playing Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For twenty nine long years the chaos wars raged. By the time hostilities ceased most of the structure of the seven magocracies had long since dissolved. The lands of Labyrinthia had been laid waste by the cataclysmic supernatural forces that had been unleashed by desperate governments in an attempt to annilate [sic] their opponents. Even the fabric of time and space had suffered as a result of these events such that it is not uncommon for portals to other times and places to temporarily open and close.

Out of this chaos and desolation came the unifying force of law. Our blessed Emperor sheltered from the destructive holocaust of conflict, deep within his underground complex was able to emerge and establish peace throughout the land.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans
boardgame.description:
The Orruks are Destruction incarnate. This vicious and primal race of natural-born killers loves nothing more than to wage unending war. Their society is built around conflict, and huge migratory invasions called Waaagh!s erupt from all corners of the Mortal Realms to drown the worlds of Order, Death, and Chaos in a green tide of violence. To face the Orruk Warclans is to face total annihilation, for their numbers are beyond counting, and they live solely for the thrill of bloody combat.

In this book, you'll discover the history of the Orruk Warclans, including their presence across the Mortal Realms and the societies that hold them together. As well as exploring the movements and motives of the orruk race, Battletome: Orruk Warclans also gives you insight into their spiritual connection to Gorkamorka, the primordial god of Destruction. The background information is complemented by a full suite of rules allowing you to field armies of Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz, or to combine all three clans into one colossal Big Waaagh!.

This 136-page hardback book contains:

– A war chest of lore about the Orruk Warclans, their history, and their activities following the return of Kragnos
– Stunning art depicting the Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and the new Kruleboyz
– 37 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for everything from sneaky Hobgrot Slittaz to the Earthquake God himself
– 15 warscroll battalions for Path to Glory narrative campaigns
– Allegiance abilities for every Orruk Warclans subfaction, including battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power, as well as the Big Waaagh! that combines Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz
– Content for matched play, including 5 grand strategies, 6 battle tactics, and 3 core battalions
– Path to Glory campaign rules for creating an Orruk Warclans warband
– A beautiful miniature showcase and painting guide for getting the most out of your Waaagh!
– Extensive bestiary information for the Orruk Warclans units, including the background of Kragnos, End of Empires

'— Description from the publisher'
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer Age Of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans

boardgame.name: Mint Works
boardgame.description:
User Summary

App version of the board game Mint Works.

boardgame.name: Hidden Games Junior: Das verschollene Schwert
boardgame.description:
A brazen theft has the citizens of Rome in an uproar. The sword of the gladiator statue "Maximus", which stands for bravery and discipline, has been stolen. Alfredo, the guide and guard of the Colosseum, is suspected of having stolen the sword. He asks you for help and already has an idea how to track down the real culprit. Go to Rome, report to Alfredo and find the landmark of past times - the sword of Maximus.

Players embark on an exciting hunt for the culprit as a team, examining real evidence, analyzing interrogations and checking alibis. Players use tools like their cell phones and blur the line between game and reality.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 6 Spieler Spieldauer: 60 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
Hidden Games Tatort: Das verschollene Schwert 7.Fall - Junior Ein dreister Diebstahl versetzt die Bürger:innen Roms in Aufruhr. Das Schwert der für Tapferkeit und Disziplin stehenden Gladiatorenstatue “Maximus” wurde gestohlen. Alfredo, der Fremdenführer und Wächter des Kolosseums, wird verdächtigt das Schwert geraubt zu haben. Er bittet euch um Hilfe und hat auch bereits eine Idee, wie man dem wahren Täter auf die Spur kommt. Fahrt nach Rom, meldet euch bei Alfredo und findet das Wahrzeichen vergangener Zeiten – Das Schwert des Maximus.
Löst im Team von bis zu 6 Detektiven diesen spannenden zweiten Kriminalfall von Hidden Games in einer multidimensionalen Jagd nach dem Täter. Untersucht echte Beweismittel, analysiert Verhöre, recherchiert online und lasst die Grenzen zwischen Spiel und Realität verschwimmen - werdet zu echten Detektiven!
Es ist keine Voraussetzung, dass ihr den ersten Krimifall bereits gespielt habt. Als Einstieg in unsere Krimireihe empfehlen wir aber, den ersten Fall vorher zu spielen.
Begebt euch im Team auf eine spannende Jagd nach den Tätern: - Untersucht echte Beweismittel - Analysiert Verhöre - Recherchiert online - Lasst die Grenze zwischen Spiel und Realität verschwimmen - Werdet zu echten Detektiven!
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Carla Caramel
boardgame.description:
It’s a sweltering day on the fairgrounds! It’s so hot that kids are lined up at Carla Caramel’s ice cream stand. You showed up just in time to help Carla with the line!

Together, help her quickly serve delicious ice cream cones to all the kids.
It’d be a shame if they melt before the kids enjoy them!

By taking turns, each players will help the ice cream vendor satisfy the kids lining up in front of her Stand by rolling a die, which will either let you add a flavor to an ice cream or move the sun one space, or roll a kid, and give an ice cream to one of the children. Once everyone gets an ice cream, you win! But be careful to the sun, which can melt the ice creams.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Carla Caramel Publisher: Loki Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Domain of the Djinn
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

A well-written and thoroughly absorbing adventure game . . . The Domain is a six-storey building, each floor consisting of a maze of rooms and passages. Along with either one or two friends, your task is (surprise, surprise!) to find the treasure hidden in one of these rooms. To do this, you and your team wander through the Domain picking up the odd artefact along the way and generally being nosey . . . It should be noted, however, that things can get distinctly hairy down in the lower regions.

The Domain, naturally enough, is inhabited by an assortment of zombies, trolls, ogres, dragons and other dodgy types who make it their business to lurk in dark corners -- doing whatever it is mythical monsters do in dark corners. On meeting one or more of the Domain's tenants, you have a number of options; including striking up a friendly conversation, and, very sensibly, getting the hell out of it! For braver souls, you also have the option to pick a fight in order to claim the contents of the room, but I should warn you that some of the occupants have distinctly violent tendencies.

Your chances of coming out of a confrontation with an irate centaur -- with the same number of limbs as when you entered the room -- depend on the relative strengths of your team and that of your opponent. These strengths are measured in terms of four factors: survival, battle, magic and communication. Initially, you have to choose your team to obtain what you feel to be the optimum combination of these factors. During your journey, the more fights you win, the more monster-types you manage to convert to your noble cause (getting rich quick), and the greater area of the maze you manage to explore, the greater your party's strength.

Before you begin your epic voyage into the unknown, take a bit of time to choose your team carefully. Magicians rate highly on communication and magic, but they don't make particularly good 'minders'; fighters are good in battle but have the IQ of educationally sub-normal carrots. Our referee recommends staying well clear of the lower levels until you have some strong fighters on your side!

Game points are awarded for various reasons: the acquisition of gold, platinum, jewels, artefacts and killing the Djinn, who, incidentally, are neither poor nor defenceless -- so don't waste any sympathy on them! The artefacts referred to include such things as Rhombs -- handy-sized hyperspace units enabling you to jump from one place to another instantly. However, they only work on the level you're on.

In case all this sounds complicated, it is. It's not the sort of game you can master in ten minutes and wonder what to do next.

Australian Personal Computer magazine's Program of the Month: TRS-80/System 80.

boardgame.name: ¡Caninos!
boardgame.description:
Español: ¡Caninos! es un juego de cartas en el que competirás para robar más pizza que los demás. Para ganar el juego debes ser el primero en reunir 50 puntos en cartas de pizza. Pero, ¿cómo?, te preguntarás. No te preocupes, estás en buenas manos; contarás con las habilidades alucinantes de un grupo de perros super poderosos que se mueren de ganas de ayudarte a robar pizza, que es algo que se les da genial. Además de robar trozos de pizza también pueden hacer trucos impresionantes que complicarán las cosas a tus contrincantes y te pondrán un poquito más cerca de la victoria.

No olvides que los demás jugadores intentarán detenerte con trucos y cartas de reacción que asustarán a tus perros. Ten cuidado y utiliza los toppings a tu favor: los toppings de aumento elevan el valor de los trozos de pizza, y los de rebaja lo disminuyen... y si la cosa se pone muy fea siempre podrás recurrir a los trucos especiales de los Sabuesos del Caos, y a las artes misteriosas de los (casi) todopoderosos Mapaches Místicos.

¡Caninos! es un juego familiar ligeramente estratégico donde tendrás que evaluar tus posibilidades, tomar decisiones y gestionar tus cartas sabiamente para convertirte en el mejor ladrón de pizza.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

¡Caninos! is a pizza card game where you will compete to steal more pizza than anybody else. Be the first to score 50 points worth of pizza slices and you'll win the game. But how? You may ask. Don't worry, we got you covered; you'll count on the amazing skills of super powerful dogs that are more than eager to steal pizza for you, and they're the best at it too! Not only can they get you pizza, but they can also do amazing tricks that will make things harder for your opponents and put you ahead of the game.

Be mindful though, other players will try to stop you with tricks and reaction cards meant to scare your dogs away. Tread lightly and use toppings to your advantage: upgrade toppings will increase the value of pizza slices while downgrade toppings will lower it... and if push comes to shove and you need some extra help you can always count on the special tricks of the Hounds of Chaos, and the mysterious ways of the (almost) almighty Mystic Raccoons.

¡Caninos! is a mildly strategic family game where you'll need to evaluate your possibilities, make some decisions, and manage your cards wisely to become the greatest pizza thief ever.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: This World is Not Yours
boardgame.description:
A 1-2 player RPG zine about generations, change, and what you leave behind.

The world is slow to change, yet ever-changing, and we are mere players on tiny stages that we have somehow managed to make revolve around us. Fortunately, the world continues to spin despite our attempts to slow down time. With our time here, where should our focus lie? On ourselves? On the world around us? On each other?

Ultimately, what legacy are we leaving behind when it is time to pass on, and what are we giving to those who come after us?

Inspired by Ben Robbins' Microscope, players explore the legacies of individual families as time marches on, and how their surroundings affect and are affected by them.

boardgame.name: Crop Circles
boardgame.description:
Strange circles have begun to appear in different corn crops... Is the first evidence of extraterrestrial life? Or is it a reinvention of the agricultural business corporation to attract tourists to their decaying farmlands?

In this Roll & Write game, each player rolls two dice and places both numbers in their chosen fields on their crop circles, trying to make the best possible combinations. Every crop circle has 7 fields, and with the numbers inside you can score every Crop Circle in different ways: forming a stair, with different numbers, with the same numbers or with neighbors numbers. At the end of the game you will score with your 8 different crop circles and the different bonus than you can take advantage of. Whoever has the bigger score will win the game.

Can you have the most attractive Crop Circles for the invasion of tourists?

-description from game developer

boardgame.name: The City
boardgame.description:
Mean Streets and Rooftop Runs

GURPS Action all but assumes that there will be streets, buildings, and people around. How else can you have car chases through crowds, classy restaurants full of femmes fatales and secret agents, and terrorist threats that menace millions? So, you grab GURPS City Stats to flesh out your town . . . and wonder how any of it matters to action heroes.

GURPS Action 9: The City shows how to use City Stats in ways that have less to do with demographics, economics, infrastructure, and politics, and a lot more to do with how many lives the terrorists are endangering, who can be bribed, what there is to climb on, and what the cops will let you get away with. The first chapter delves into detail on Action interpretations of the stats. The second offers six ready-to-use examples ranging from a logging camp to a megalopolis.

A cool action flick needs cool shooting locations!

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: The Dungeon Near the Shadow
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The persistent suborbital occlusion sits writhing in the west. It dropped from the heavens, some say, or maybe it bubbled out of the ground or burst out of the space between air, three years past. Some call it the shadow for how it negates the light, drowning everything it covers in opaque darkness. The sun no longer sets in the west: it disappears into the shadow, and each evening you can hear prayers at every hearth that it returns unchanged the next day. Most things that enter the shadow do not return, and if they do, they are seldom unchanged.

Alice the Train is a light-weight, pick-up and deliver board game that is based on the children's book of the same name. In this game, you play as trains with the mission of picking up animals and dropping them off at the zoo. You will build and manage your train cars based on how many animals each can hold while in the "vores" variant, separating the carnivorous tigers from the herbivores of the game. Collect stars when dropping off animals at the zoo with the winner being the player closest to 15 stars.

Tex Willer is a very popular Italian comic book, started in 1948 and still running. Tex Willer, the main character, is a Texas Ranger. American Natives call him "Aquila della Notte" (Night Eagle).

boardgame.name: Mask of Shame
boardgame.description:
The tower and its monsters stand between your ninja clan's rightful place of rule. You must use every fiber of cunning in this push your luck battle.

Draw seven weapon cards and use them to fight your way to the top. Be careful though, not having the right weapons means a long drop to the foot of the tower.

Weapons are made up of 3 colors (red,blue, and yellow) and 2 types (basic and legendary). The Blue Swords, Red Spears, and Yellow Magic Staffs. The legendary weapons also come with powers.

Each level of the tower has one of 7 different monster types. Discard the matching symbol weapons to advance. Your hand size will continue to shrink as you climb the tower thus making it much harder to have the right weapons.

Other clans are also battling their way to ensure they too are noticed. Play through three rounds of cumulating victory points. The player who is in last in between rounds receives the Mask of Shame - A Legendary Item that makes its holder immune, but at great cost to one's honor.

Will you climb your way into the Halls of Honor or be stained with the Shadows of Shame?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: All Time Wrestling
boardgame.description:
"Clack! Zap! Boom!" A frightening roar echoes through the chambers of the arena. This is the sound of something sinister. This is a beast, grinding and twisting, bending the forces of the universe to the will of its master, a master who is obsessed with finding the definitive answer to the question of "Who is the greatest wrestler of all time?"

Now, his beast, the world's only time machine, brings forward the very best — champions of past, present and future generations. legends who seek to cement their legacy as the best of all time. This is where legends collide. This is where your destiny awaits.

All Time Wrestling is a card-and-dice game that brings the fast-paced action and excitement of professional wrestling to your tabletop. With standard and advanced modes of play, ATW is accessible to gamers and non-gamers alike, using intuitive mechanisms that are reminiscent of your favorite wrestling games.

Choose your champion from the legends of past, present and future, each with their own deck of attacks, abilities, signature moves, and finishers! Play your cards to unleash devastating combos, powerbombs and piledrivers, aerial stunts and deadly submissions...but will the dice be in your favor?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Devil's Level: Expansion Sets
boardgame.description:
This set includes five expansion sets for The Devil's Level card game, totaling 144 cards. The Expansions are:

Not Safe for Work: 36 cards that let you steal from your boss and waste time. And you can mess up your customers and other people at work.

Legacy of Boodleheimer: Let's you use Boodleheimer's spirit to control stuff that happens in the game. It gives you cat powers and cat functions.

Sorry I'm Sorry: 36 cards that are about screwing up and breaking stuff all the time. Because it happens to me.

Foil Pack: KS exclusive Foil backed cards.

Admin Pack: KS exclusive pack of ultra-powerful cards designed by the Admin to sneak into your hand during play, unbalance the game, and make your friends mad.

boardgame.name: Forty Thieves
boardgame.description:
A board game using cards from a traditional deck, Ace through 10 in four suits, and a 6X6 square grid, and colored pieces of two colors. Each square on the grid is labeled with a number representing all combination of products of the card ranks, e.g. 1 (1X1),2 (2X1),3, 4 (2X2, 4X1)..81 (9X9). Two players take turns play a card from their hands into either one of two rows, and then place a piece of their color into the location on the board matching the product of the two cards. For instance if a 3 is the top most card exposed and they play a 7 they could put a piece into square 21. This continues until a player gets four pieces in a row or the other folds.

—user summary

boardgame.name: 1001 Islands
1001 Isole
boardgame.description:
As children of Sinbad, you have set yourselves a new challenge to explore the 1001 islands and find the treasures of your father, the great sailor.

1001 Islands is a tile-selection and -distribution game in which you score points by matching your dream tiles and your island tiles as best as possible. A game takes 16 rounds, with each player adding one tile to their personal board to build their island or collect dream tiles, then players tally their points.

In more detail, when you're the active player, you draw as many tiles as the number of players, keep one and play it on your board, then pass the remaining tiles to the player of your choice. Whoever receives the final tile has no choice, but they start the next round. The dream tiles score you points based on what's visible on your island at game's end, so don't take a Fennec fox dream tile if your island is devoid of Fennec foxes! Palm trees earn points on their own, as does the pairing of a Rukh bird and its huge egg. Have too many bandits, and you'll lose points — and if you collect a third magic lamp, you have to flip two tiles face down, costing you whatever points you would have received.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet

boardgame.name: Puffin Rock: Spin & Find
boardgame.description:
Puffin Rock: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lustful Valley
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A dark dating simulator with Adventure game elements about two sisters in the town of Dailand where the younger sister, Victoria went to try her luck to get a good job and money. She was supposed to call her older sister Anna when she arrived to Dailand, but she never did. Now Anna goes there to find out what happened.

boardgame.name: Legacy of Blood
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Once one of the mightiest families of all the Nine Kingdoms, the Leorics have now fallen on hard times. Dark tidings and unspeakable rumors surround this once noble house. But a chance at redemption may still be at hand. In a desperate race against time, the heroes must recover a cache of lost magical artifacts before they fall into the hands of agents of the Darkmaster. Only this way they can restore the fallen noble family’s legacy, and stop the darkness spreading through their domains.
Can they reach the treasure before the agents of the Darkmaster pursuing them? Can they sneak past the dragon who has made Castle Dulgroth her lair? Can they survive this Legacy of Blood?

boardgame.name: The Festival of Reaptide
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In the sleepy town of Fayhollow, the Festival of Reaptide marks the end of the vibrant Summer months, and the beginning of the road to Winter time. The Festival is a merry event, celebrating life's triumph over death. People dress as monsters from folk-legends, and decorate the town with all manner of spooky ornaments. This year, a group of adventurers happen to be passing through the town just as the festivities are in full swing. They're more than welcome to take part, though it might just be that a real evil lurks closer than anyone realizes…

- A short horror themed 5e adventure, aimed at characters level 3 to 4
- Comes with two battlemaps, both labeled and unlabeled for players and GMs
- Features rules and prizes for six exciting festival activities
- Includes multiple tables with a variety of combat and roleplay encounters
- Several new stat blocks and a new magical item

boardgame.name: A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos
boardgame.description:
A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos is a lighter version of H.D.P.: Hasta Donde Puedas.

Play begins with a judge choosing a black question or fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of ten white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card to the Judge Czar, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The Judge determines which answer card is the funniest one in the context of the question or fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the Judge becomes the new Judge for the next round. Play continues until a player collects 5 points.

boardgame.name: Chain Mail: Blank Character Card
boardgame.description: A blank character card to create your own.

boardgame.name: El Gran Descamisado
boardgame.description:
El Gran Descamisado is a board game that combines strategy, general culture, consensus, chance, attention, verbal dexterity and mental agility. Through seven games that refer to the main milestones in the history of Peronism, an attempt will be made to obtain the seven "Peronist emblems" to become El Gran Descamisado.

To start the game, the players will concentrate their Peronist pawns at the “starting point” and will return there each time their game turn ends. In their corresponding turn, each partner must turn the historical clock. When the needle stops, it will indicate the game to be played, associated with a certain event in the history of Peronism. Each of these games may be individual, in pairs or in a group, as appropriate and will allow to win a Peronist emblem. This dynamic will be repeated until someone meets the ultimate goal of obtaining the 7 emblems.

"Pact of Loyalty": Game of pacts and agreements. Loyalty (and trust) ensures that both parties are favored. If ambition wins, it will become an all-or-nothing challenge.

"Trivia Compañera": Classic question and answer game about curious and historical data of Peronism.

"Choosing a candidate": Voting game where everyone chooses who they think best represents the topic of the slogan that summons them in the electoral act.

"The Renunciation": A game of strategy and chance, where three slogans must be answered blindly, accepting the consequences.

"Peronometer": Fun group game where attention and concentration will allow you to succeed in not stumbling in Peronist calls and gestures.

"La Censura": Classic game where you must guess a censored word from the clues and guidance of your partner, who will also be limited in not mentioning the prohibited words.

"Viva Perón": Verbal skill group game, showing creativity and ingenuity to create linguistic combinations against the clock.


El Gran Descamisado es un juego de mesa que combina estrategia, cultura general, consenso, azar, atención, destreza verbal y agilidad mental. A través de siete juegos que remiten a los principales hitos de la historia del peronismo, se intentará conseguir los siete “emblemas peronistas” para convertirse en EL GRAN DESCAMISADO. 

Para iniciar la partida los/las jugadores/as concentrarán sus peones peronistas en el “punto de inicio” y regresarán allí cada vez que finalice su turno de juego. En su turno correspondiente cada compañero o compañera deberá girar el reloj histórico. Cuando la aguja se detenga, ésta indicará el juego a desarrollar, asociado a determinado suceso de la historia del peronismo. Cada uno de estos juegos podrá ser individual, en duplas o grupal, según corresponda y permitirá ganar un emblema peronista. Se repetirá esta dinámica hasta que alguien cumpla el objetivo final de obtener los 7 emblemas.

Juegos:
1) 1945: 17 de Octubre “Día de la Lealtad”. Juego: “Pacto de lealtad” Emblema: Escudo PJ
2) 1946: Primera Presidencia. Juego: “Trivia compañera” Emblema: Marcha Peronista
3) 1947: Voto femenino. Ley 13.010. Juego: “Eligiendo candidato/a”. Emblema: Carnet de afiliación
4) 1951: Cabildo Abierto del Justicialismo. Juego: “La Renuncia”. Emblema: Bombo peronista
5) 1952: Segunda Presidencia. Juego: “Peronómetro”. Emblema: Choripan y vino
6) 1955: Golpe de Estado y Proscripción. Juego: “La Censura” Emblema: No me olvides
7) 1973: Tercera Presidencia. Juego: “Viva Perón”. Emblema: Dedos en V

“Pacto de Lealtad”: Juego de pactos y acuerdos. La lealtad (y confianza) asegura que ambas partes salgan favorecidas. Si gana la ambición, se transformará en un desafío a todo o nada.

“Trivia Compañera”: Clásico juego de preguntas y respuestas sobre datos curiosos e históricos del peronismo.

“Eligiendo candidato/a”: Juego de votación donde todos y todas eligen a quien creen que mejor representa el tópico de la consigna que los convoca en el acto eleccionario.

“La Renuncia”: Juego de estrategia y azar, donde deberá responderse a ciegas tres consignas acatando las consecuencias.

“Peronómetro”: Divertido juego grupal donde la atención y concentración permitirá salir airoso/a de no trastabillar en los llamados y ademanes peronistas.

“La Censura”: Clásico juego donde se deberá adivinar una palabra censurada a partir de las pistas y orientaciones de su compañero o compañera, que también se encontrará limitado/a en no mencionar las palabras prohibidas.

“Viva Perón”: Juego grupal de destreza verbal, debiendo demostrar la creatividad e ingenio para crear combinaciones lingüísticas contrarreloj.

boardgame.name: Square play-on
boardgame.description:
Square Play-on is a name re-defined based on the shape
This is also called Indian LUDO sometimes. It is one of the oldest board games extant. (Don’t know the Origins of the Game) It is played in many homes of India (particularly in the south part of India even today still being popular and known to everyone. There are references to this game in some ancient Indian epics like the Mahabharata.
The most common names are Chauka Bara (Kannada) Ashta Chamma (Telugu) and a list of various names and regions are given below
Chouka Bara , Katte Mane ,Gatta Mane - Kannada - Mysuru region
Chakaara or Chakka - Kannada - North Karnataka
Pakidakali , Kavidi Kali - Malayalam - Kerala region
Ashta Chamma - Telugu - Andhra Pradesh/Telangana
Daayam or Thaayam - Tamil - Tamil Nadu
Atthu, Kanna Kauri ,Chunga ,Cheeta ,Chanda —Hindi -Madhya Pradesh and central India region
Champool/ Kach kangri - Marathi - Maharashtra
Baji ,Chomal Ishto,Kaangi chaala - Gujarati
Changa po - Rajasthan (source: Wikipedia)

This Game is a two- or four-player board game, Usually written by chalk on the floor as and when required. This game is an example of a fully observable positional system of pawns that has an element of chance introduced by the roll of cowry shells and an element of strategy (The strategy being the pawn the player decides to move after the roll ). While traditionally played with 4 or 6 cowry shells, Dice in particular Stick dice can also be used.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Traditional Games: Alquerque / Fanorona (Indian War Games)

boardgame.name: Vyapar
boardgame.description:
Vyapar is a game of trading using the random outcomes of dice and cards. It's a mid-level game for ages +10 and above as involves calculation and strategies to spend less and earn more with multiple trading opportunities to earn.
The time limit of the game varies from 30 min to 90 min depending on the random outcome.

The synopsis of the game is similar to a stock market scenario where you will buy and sell Commodities of Gold silver and copper
The game is played on the board where you will land on buy/sell or change rate or power lot multiples by the random outcome of the custom dice and based on the action you will do the activity
There is a set goal to reach the end by having the minimum required quantity of certain commodities and above so that winner is declared. the fluctuation in the market makes you rich or bankruptcy.

boardgame.name: RathaYatra
boardgame.description:
The game mechanics are a race game kind of but with certain Rules like One cannot move earlier to the place before the other and there are chances that it will come back lose a turn kind of actions in it

This game is inspired by Rathayatra pulling of chariots and a few rules that Jagannatha Ratha cannot surpass the other 2 and Balabadara will start followed by Subhadra and Jagannatha ( here it is colored Ratha ).

This can be played solo and the design has been made to accommodate 8 players with their own path

The game consists of a central Dice tower, a path to move the chariots, 2 custom dice(one to the chariot and the other no of places forward or back), and action cards to change the course of the game.

The player movement is based on the Random outcome of Dice and Random action cards.

boardgame.name: Amrutha
boardgame.description:
A game-based on card random pick to create a deck (set of Components) to form based on a Quest card or achieve Requirement as defined during the start of the game (combination of 108 water cards(sum)and 2 ingredients of each type)
The winner is the fastest to complete with the least possible deck set of the Ingredients

The game is played between 2-6 players.
It's a mid-level game for ages +8 and above as involves calculation and strategies to make sure you win with lesser cards and fastest to do the calculation and submit the set of cards
The time limit of the game varies from 10 min to 30 min depending on random outcome and level of gameplay.
There are various levels involved in this game to increase the complexity of calculations, increase the difficulty, and also to have killing strategies to make the opponent rebuild his complete deck thereby increasing the chance to win.

The game has 2 variation sets with 8 levels in the game from simple to advanced combination of ingredients

The advantage and limitation is both the calculations as you need to calculate the combination by mind mathematics(this majorly helps the children to do fast calculations of addition and multiplication).

boardgame.name: Operation Khedda
boardgame.description:
Max 4 Players (solo variant to multiplayer variant)
the game has a setup of Tile laying (every time a new random Board is created using hexagon terrain tiles)and Actual movement of chasing elephants after on the terrain with the advantage of the terrain and the player character

Co-operative resource placement of the operational component
Co-operative actions to capture the wild elephant (3 wild elephants out of 4 elephants)
Random elephant movement (4 X 2 (custom dice) directional dice to work this mechanism on direction and no of places to move in that direction)
Placement of campsites (only in the first turn) and Capture mechanism by a player in subsequent rounds as actions by the player
Placement of capture mechanism by each player every round (excluding some terrain and based on terrain type.

Once all the player places the mechanism is done. a random player rolls the dice(Elephant movement dice) using Dice tower and based on the outcome the elephants move towards the indicated direction

If there is an obstacle it cannot move that direction(excluding a few obstacles and group movements)
The game continues until all or min 3 elephants move to Khedda or all campsites destroyed by the movement of elephants(Detailed rules on win is there in the rulebook)

boardgame.name: Rescue Punda
boardgame.description:
A cooperative rescue operation game to safeguard the little naughty elephant to its family
this game is an extended edition of Operation Khedda and uses the same tiles and few characters to play

as earlier indicated the game is played on the same components of Operation khedda( Terrain Tiles and obstacles are the same) with certain changes to accommodate the fantasy theme of rescuing little Naughty Elephant. Here the player instead of capturing works on a clearing of a path for the elephant to join its heard from starting point to endpoint ( currently 2 sets of rules one with timed/ 24 rounds co-operative game and the other with one player as a ranger to capture and second player as a rescuer)
and win is the same Elephant rescued/captured or lost in the woods ( co-operative strategy).

boardgame.name: Sala
boardgame.description:
A game based on the folklore of the start of the Hoysala kingdom.

Kannada folklore tells a tale of a young man, Sala, who saved his Jain guru, Sudatta, by striking dead a lion or tiger he encountered near the temple of the goddess Vasantika at Angadi. The word "strike" literally translates to "hoy" in Old Kannada, hence the name "Hoy-sala".

The game is played on terrain consisting of forest gurukul, school village, and farmland with the terrain of water stream pathways (a graphic of terrain and to consider a single terrain board or randomizer of terrain tiles work is in progress)

There will be the hero who is making a choice to consider the advice given by the guru, student, village lady, and a farmer based on the sighting of a lion (random cards) and based on the movement outcome of the dice/cards MP the sala can move to the desired location on the map and place obstacles (traps and fence mechanism)

A random Cards mechanism (a staged order) will provide the sighting of the lion after Sala movement and placement. there will 5 lion appearances and movements using the Dice and directional outcome-based of the card. If you are able to capture the lions before it hits the central temple Sala wins( co-operative team) else lost.

boardgame.name: Worldbreakers: Advent of the Khanate
boardgame.description:
It is the late 13th century and history is altered by the rise of the Worldbreakers, individuals who harness the mysterious substance mythium to magnify their natural talents. The Mongol princess Khutulun, a Worldbreaker and a descendent of the great Chinggis Khan, is reuniting the distant tribes of the Mongol Empire. However, other factions are rising to oppose her, each with their own agenda.

Worldbreakers: Advent of the Khanate is a customizable two-player card game. Players start the game with a Worldbreaker that has a unique special ability and a deck of 30 cards. Each player aims to be the first to reach 10 power, which is gained by developing Location cards and by attacking the opponent.

The game is divided into rounds, during each of which the players alternate taking turns. A turn is composed of one action, such as gaining mythium (the currency of the game), drawing a card, playing a card, or attacking the opponent. Worldbreakers has three card types: events, followers, and locations. Events are impactful one-time effects. Followers are people who join your cause and can either defend your board or attack your opponent. Finally, Locations are places where mythium can be collected. They have a numbered list of stages, each of which can be developed for a one-time bonus such as power or resources.

Proper timing and resource management is key to victory: wait too long, and your opponent will mount a crushing attack or finish developing their Locations for a power advantage. Who will wrestle control of mythium and forever reshape history?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dragons vs Ogres
boardgame.description:
Dragons vs Ogres is a fantasy themed two-player card game. It is a speed/dexterity game where players compete to capture the most villagers. It has elements of the card games War and Old Maid.

In Dragons vs Ogres, players choose to play as either dragons or ogres and each have ten cards. They draw a hand of five cards to begin the game. A deck of forty villagers is placed at the center of the table. Players flip up a villager, one at a time. The fastest player to capture that villager scores one point. However, the card used to capture the villager must meet one of three conditions:

Exceed the number
Match the number
Be the correct corresponding image


Depending on which condition a player uses to capture a villager, they might return the dragon or ogre card used to their hand, discard it and draw a new card, or shuffle their discard pile back into their deck and draw back up to five cards.

There are forty villagers and only twenty combined dragons and ogres. So each card must be used an average of two times in order to capture half the villagers. If one player runs out of cards, the other may keep playing until they are also out of cards. Players must be quick enough to beat their opponent to the villager but clever enough to make matches.

boardgame.name: King's Colour
boardgame.description:
King's Color is a chess variant, played on a tri-colored hex-hex board. Each king is confined to a 3x3 castle surrounded by a wall. The other pieces are rooks or bishops, which promote to queens. The big twist to this game is that when the king moves onto a different color, all the rooks become bishops, and all the bishops on the new color become rooks.

Capturing is limited to pieces inside the castle, which influences the game to be oriented around checkmate rather than attrition.

boardgame.name: Mimetix: S'envoie en l'air
boardgame.description:
In Mimetix "s'envoie en l'air", in less than a minute, we have fun mimicking the spicy expressions of lovers ... of the French language! Get ready to "heat up" and "get it right", without necessarily "going to the pan"!
In less than a minute, act out and have your team guess as many phrases as possible. Easy ? Imagine miming literally “taking a rake” or “having a puck in the drawer”. The funniest in addition to the extravagant mimes? Fabulous responses from players pulling their hair out and tangling their brushes guessing the expression. You will find 2 rule variations, 3 difficulty levels of expressions and action cards to spice up the game even more!

boardgame.name: Pigeon Pigeon 2: Le Retour Du Bluff
boardgame.description:
In this quiz game, make up false answers that are more likely than the real one. The more the opposing team bets on it, the more chips it loses, the closer you get to victory!

No more bluffing and more laughs with 440 amazing new cards!

boardgame.name: Texto 2.0
boardgame.description: Texto is back in a new version, playable alone or combined with the first version. You will discover 10 new themes to complete or renew your game.

boardgame.name: Wings of Steel
boardgame.description: Fight the air battles of the Pacific Theater in WWII

boardgame.name: North Africa '41
boardgame.description:
North Africa '41 is a game that will represent the campaign in North Africa from Rommel's first offensive in March 1941 to December 1941. Combat units represent regiments, brigades and battalions. Each game turn represents half a month, but a game turn is further divided into 3 Impulses representing 4-5 days.

This is a complete redo of The Legend Begins which will feature all new order of battle and map research.
